results.description:
It's a New Year and our resolution is to fight for more access to Long Island parkland and beaches for our dogs! Join us Thurs., Jan. 21st at Eleanor Rigby's in Mineola as we plot our next moves to make Long Island more dog-friendly!

The holidays are behind us and as we head into the heart of winter, we long to duplicate those magazine cover moments that we see of dogs enjoying the snow and the great outdoors.  With tens of thousands of acres of parkland off limits to our furry best friends here on Long Island, our choices to enjoy the outdoors with them are limited and often restricted to our backyards.  If you're in the growing group of Long Island taxpaying citizens frustrated with the lack of "dog friendly" areas and tired of seeing those "NO DOGS ALLOWED" signs, then join us at our next meeting to hear about how you can help to change that!

At LI-DOG, our mission is to continue to expand dog owner access to public parkland.  In addition to helping to create dog parks, LI-DOG also strives for more ON-LEASH access to public trails and parks as well as off-leash access to Long Island's many miles of public beaches. 

Learn about our latest efforts on those fronts including the latest on a dog park in the Town of Hempstead, more on-leash walking trails in Nassau County parks, and continued discussions with New York State about access to beaches.  In addition, you can find out about upcoming dog-related events.   Anyone that’s interested in helping with these campaigns and/or events should come to the meeting where you will also hear about our latest success stories.

PLUS, we want to hear from you!  Do you know of other parks or beaches that would be great for on-leash or off-leash exercise and play?  As always, we need your input as well as volunteers to keep our initiatives moving.  So, please don't settle for your dog catching snowballs in the yard this Winter.  Join us for our next meeting on January 21st as we continue to plot our next moves to make Long Island more dog-friendly!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us in the back room!
results.name: LI-DOG Jan. 2016 Meeting: Our Resolution Is to Fight for More Access to LI Parks

results.description:
How signing up works: First come first serve

The Place: We will be doing the four course menu, which costs $95 before tax and tip. 

Menu Here: http://www.betony-nyc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/Betony-Dinner-Menu-WEB-12.8.15.pdf

Betony, named after an herb in the mint family known for its healing qualities, is a warm, inviting Modern American restaurant overseen by Executive Chef Bryce Shuman (formerly Executive Sous Chef of Eleven Madison Park) and General Manager Eamon Rockey (formerly of Eleven Madison Park, Atera, Aska). The restaurant, which is located a block off of Fifth Avenue, features soaring ceilings, contemporary photos of New York City street scenes, a vibrant 35-seat bar and lounge and 85-seat dining room

Prepay: Because the restaurant has my credit card I am asking for $100 up front. This money will be returned to you in full when you show up on time for the meal. Prepay with Venmo is preferred but I can also do Paypal or Chase Quickpay.


RSVPs:

Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. If there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to be able to do so. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Betony- Michelin Star

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]

results.description:
Don't be intimidated by the title. This is still a go-at-your-own pace run, with stops and looping back for people. We just kindly suggest that you take it at your not-so-casual pace, whatever that may mean to you.

We will meet just inside the 52nd Street entrance to Windmuller Park at 7:15pm and head out for a 6ish mile loop through Woodside, Sunnyside, LIC, and Greenpoint, before returning to the start. 

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we will wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt. 

If there is interest after we complete our run, we may venture to a pub for snacks and/or beverages.

This is an open Circle for all members.

This weekly session is to build upon the skills that you learned in our workshops. We get to practice and go into greater depth.

While many of my groups are run with a go with the flow attitude, this will:

• Begin and end on time

• 10 min opening meditation

• Cleansing

• A 10 min of discussion/question answer

• And 60 min of hands on application

• 10 min of closing

• We will begin promptly at 7:30 and end at 9:00

We will review and proceed to build on your existing knowledge and move together into new topics of exploration.

Your intuition requires practice and dedication to fully open and control. Should this group grow and demonstrate the need for more frequent gatherings, we will implement a schedule that meets on a more frequent basis.

results.description:
Friends, 


Following the success of our last lecture, and based on popular demand, we will have another lecture on Thursday, January 21st. This next lecture will delve deeper into Kabbalah's explanation of perception of reality and the Kabbalistic best and proven instrument: the circle. Tell your friends! And hope to see you soon. 

IMPORTANT UPDATE: This lecture will precede a MIND-BOGGLING, LIFE-ALTERING, REVOLUTIONARY 10-week course that will explore some of the most fundamental laws that shape our reality. Special deals available for those who register with their friends and/or spouses. More details at the lecture! 

What Is Life?

“Indeed, if we set our hearts to answer but one very famous question, I am certain that all these questions and doubts will vanish from the horizon, and you will look unto their place to find them gone. This indignant question is a question that the whole world asks, namely, ‘What is the meaning of life?”.

—Kabbalist Yehuda Ashlag (Baal HaSulam)

Does life have meaning? Why are so many people suffering? What happens to us when we die? Where did we come from? Authentic Kabbalah was made to answer these and all of life’s deepest questions. Take a tour of the laws shaping your life. Discover insights the ancient Kabbalists had into nature’s program and the purpose behind it. In this two hour lecture, we’re going to debunk the many myths surrounding Kabbalah, answer your questions, and explain how you can take the first step into the path of spiritual attainment using Kabbalah’s most practical methodology.

Why Attend?

* Deepen your understanding of nature, the world, & who we really are,

* Increase awareness of the source of problems in our personal lives and in society


* Get tools for developing a new perspective on the world around us,

* A learning experience that’ll shed new light on what it means to living in today’s world.

* Gain wisdom to optimally react to, & even reverse, the rise in so many of the world’s problems.

* Ask experienced Kabbalah instructors questions & get answers face-to-face.
results.name: What Is Life? Free Introductory Lecture: Part 2

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

results.description:
In response to many requests, this year we're going to offer a LONG POSE session! ONE POSE for two hours (breaks every half hour). This is a terrific opportunity to really refine and develop both your drawing technique and your powers of observation. (you'll be surprised how fast the time passes!).

We'll have a great nude art model, and the class will be open to artists of all skill levels (though this may have more appeal to more experienced artists). Bring your own art materials and your eagle eye and expect to get some great work done!

Long pose sessions are offered by very few places and we've had enough requests that it seemed worthwhile adding it to our events. If you'd like to see this become a permanent part of our offerings, please show your support--join us, and tell your friends!

results.name: WHAT IS LIFE? Free intro lecture to authentic Kabbalah, 2: Perception of Reality

results.description:
Friends, Following the success of our last lecture, and based on popular demand, we will have another lecture on Thursday, January 21st. This next lecture will delve deeper into Kabbalah's explanation of perception of reality and the Kabbalistic best and proven instrument: the circle. Tell your friends! And hope to see you soon. IMPORTANT UPDATE: This lecture will precede a MIND-BOGGLING, LIFE-ALTERING, REVOLUTIONARY 10-week course that will explore some of the most fundamental laws that shape our reality. Special deals available for those who register with their friends and/or spouses. More details at the lecture! What Is Life?

“Indeed, if we set our hearts to answer but one very famous question, I am certain that all these questions and doubts will vanish from the horizon, and you will look unto their place to find them gone. This indignant question is a question that the whole world asks, namely, ‘What is the meaning of life?”.

—Kabbalist Yehuda Ashlag (Baal HaSulam)

Does life have meaning? Why are so many people suffering? What happens to us when we die? Where did we come from? Authentic Kabbalah was made to answer these and all of life’s deepest questions. Take a tour of the laws shaping your life. Discover insights the ancient Kabbalists had into nature’s program and the purpose behind it. In this two hour lecture, we’re going to debunk the many myths surrounding Kabbalah, answer your questions, and explain how you can take the first step into the path of spiritual attainment using Kabbalah’s most practical methodology.

Why Attend?

* Deepen your understanding of nature, the world, & who we really are,

* Increase awareness of the source of problems in our personal lives and in society

* Get tools for developing a new perspective on the world around us,

* A learning experience that’ll shed new light on what it means to living in today’s world.

* Gain wisdom to optimally react to, & even reverse, the rise in so many of the world’s problems.

* Ask experienced Kabbalah instructors questions & get answers face-to-face.
results.name: What Is Life? Intro Lecture Part 2 - Manhattan Edition

results.description:
Too Cool to Be Forgotten by Alex Robinson

From the critically-acclaimed cartoonist behind Box Office Poison and Tricked comes the delightful Too Cool to Be Forgotten, a story of second chances. Andy Wicks is a forty-something father of two who's tried everything to quit smoking -- from going cold turkey, to the latest patches and nicotine chewing gums -- so he figures he'll give this hypnosis thing a try. What's the worst that could happen? Unfortunately, Andy gets dealt a fate worse than death: high school! Transported back to 1985, Andy returns to his formative years as a gangly, awkward teenager. Is he doomed to relive the mistakes of his past, or has he been given a second chance to get things right? One thing's for sure -- this time he's going to ask out that girl from math class...
results.name: NBCBC #44: Too Cool to Be Forgotten by Alex Robinson

results.description:
A hilarious, action-packed look at the apocalypse that combines a touching tale of friendship, a thrilling war story, and an all out kung-fu infusedmission to save the world.Gonzo Lubitch and his best friend have been inseparable since birth. They grew up together, they studiedmartial arts together, they rebelled in college together, and they fought in the Go-Away War together. Now, with the world in shambles and dark nightmarish clouds billowing over the wastelands, they have been tapped for an incredibly perilous mission. But they quickly realize that this assignment is not all it seems, and before it is over they will have encountered everything from mimes, ninjas, and pirates to one ultra-sinister mastermind, whose only goal is world domination.


“A flat-out ferociously good novel.... Reads like a surrealist smashup of Pynchon and Pratchett, Vonnegut and Heller.”—Austin Chronicle

“Harkaway delivers plenty of action and surprises.... Likely to be this season’s major conversation-starter.”—San Francisco Chronicle

“A gripping, satirical, postapocalyptic war epic populated with mimes, ninjas, bureaucrats, chimera, and gun-toting nerds.”—New York Magazine

"Very funny and hugely entertaining. . . . And brilliant. Read it."—Milwaukee Journal Sentinel 

"Bewilders, amazes, entertains. . . . a Catch-22 for the 21st century. . . . a work of extraordinary imagination and charisma. . . genius"—The New York Observer
results.name: January's Post-Apocalyptic Book Club Discussion: Nick Harkaway's Gone-Away World

results.description:
Whether you're completely new to meditation, fresh out of an MBSR class, or an advanced practitioner wanting to find a local sangha (supportive, like-minded individuals who help deepen your practice), this weekly meditation is open to all.

This week's group will include a guided sitting meditation in the Vipassana (Mindfulness) tradition and a short walking meditation. Our sit will be followed by question/answer and discussion. Chairs provided, though feel free to bring a yoga mat, blanket or cushions. No charge, but dana (a donation) will be gratefully accepted. (Suggested donation $10, but please give what is right for you.)

* The Meetup RSVP list doesn't reflect actual attendance, since those from Insight Timer and other meditation groups also attend.

results.description:
Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

Please, read carefully before you RSVP!!

This will be the official Korean beginner's class. The class material will be provided. We will go through all the basics and foundations, and practice with fun activities.

Level description:

We will practice mostly the basic sentence structure using proper particles. Basic action verbs, verb conjugation, present tense, and pronunciation & speaking. You must know Hangul and can read/write comfortably

Since I need to book a space ahead, please consider your RSVP seriously and let me know if you can't make it after you said YES to come.

Please, email me at [masked] with your contact number if you can come. I will send mine so we can communicate better when the meet up happens.

The class fee will be $15 per person. Once you commit for 4 weeks series of classes it will be $40. Please, note you won't get a credit if you cancel your attendance on the same day. Be prepared for the class! :)

We may hang out and mingle after the class. I'm very excited to see you all and look forward to it! 
If you have any questions,please leave a comment.

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Saturday, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.why: Writers develop their story telling skills through steady writing and constructive feedback delivered by their peers. This group is full of talented writers willing to give their time to help others develop their craft.
results.name: Sam's BSFW Short Story Meetup

results.description:
Join us for our new open house potluck dinner night! It's for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC and anyone (over 18) who wants to learn more about the OM practice and what we do! We will be playing one of our favorite games, Hot Seats! 

Hot Seats is a fun communication game where one person at a time can volunteer to have the attention the rest of the group placed on them for 1-2 minutes while they can be asked any question on any topic. You can chose to lie, tell the truth, or pass, but it's always encouraged to let your true self come out in a safe a fun environment.

Whether you are someone who already OMs, you are curious and want to meet some of the OM community, or you just want to enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too! If you can't or don't have time, just bring $10 to drop in the jar. 

It's a casual atmosphere and one of our favorite ways to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. 

The event is free! The door will open at 7:45 and lock at 8:10 sharp, so please be on time!

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]  
Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: Open House! Community Potluck & Hot Seats

results.description:
Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change.

In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

Fun Play
No Sliding
Game restarts from goalie
Kick-ins.. no throw ins 
Corner kicks

By Car - Cross the RFK Bridge and take the I-278 exit towards Randalls Island. Turn right onto Central Rd until it turns into Hell Gate Circle. Turn Right crossing under the RFK Bridge onto Sunken Garden Loop.  Help SEC is across from Fields 90-91.

By Bus - Take the M-35 bus which leaves from 125th St and Lexington Ave in front of the Duane Reade. It is the second to last stop on the bus route.

By Train - Take the 4-5 train to 125th St. Transfer to the M-35 bus.

If you have any problems please call Ben on[masked]Two or Chris on[masked]Six.

Street Soccer USA is sports for social change. Using our entrepreneurial instinct as well as evidence based practices, we make a measurable difference in the lives of undeserved youth in urban areas and special needs populations, including homeless families, adults, people in recovery, among others.

The time has come for us to honor those psychonauts who have dedicated their lives to the exploration of inner space. The Consortium of Psychonautics has selected Spiros Antonopolous as the first inductee into the Psychonaut Hall of Fame. Please come and help us celebrate his legacy with psychedelic storytelling from raconteurs such as Martin Dockery; who actually recreated the now infamous LSD infused bicycle ride of Dr. Albert Hoffman from his lab at Sandoz Pharmaceutics to his home in Basel, Switzerland. The Consortium of Psychonautics includes: Psymposia,
The Psychedelic Society of Brooklyn,
& Consciousness Hacking NYC

results.description:
HAF Sessions feature festival artists and hopefuls at various venues in Harlem. They’re designed to give you a taste of what the festival is about, connect the festival and the community, and give us all an excuse to enjoy the amazing talent around us!

IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO PERFORM AT THE OPEN MIC, CLICK HERE TO SIGN UP!

OPEN MIC SESSION

Meet and perform with some of HAF's[masked] artists in Silvana's underground music stage, hookah lounge/falafel shawarma restaurant, and bar! As is custom, HAF will be doing a special giveaway raffle, and closing the night with a DJ dance party!

Tickets are only $9.39 (including service charge) in advance.

CLICK HERE TO BUY ADVANCE TICKETS

Where will we meet?

Daniel will be downstairs in Silvana to hold a few seats for group members who purchase tickets. As always, if there are any questions, you're running late, etc. feel free to reach him at 774.275.3646.

Directions of Silvana:

Silvana is located at 300 W 116th St., between Frederick Douglass Blvd. (8th Ave.) and Manhattan Ave. in Central Harlem. The closest subway stop is the B & C local train lines to the 116th Street station. Nearby bus lines include the M10, M7, & M3.


About the Harlem Arts Festival

The Harlem Arts Festival (www.harlemartsfestival.com) produces a multidisciplinary arts festival in June of each year, showcasing local performers and visual artists that inspire and nourish the artistic community in Harlem. Taking place in the newly renovated Richard Rodgers Amphitheater and the surrounding park, the goal of the Harlem Arts Festival is to fuel the prosperity of our neighborhood, and mark the Amphitheater as a world‐class cultural venue. We are interested in presenting artists across genres — dance, music, theater, and visual arts — whose work contributes to the popular dialogue of the Harlem community.

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."

THRIVE in 2016’s Evolving Financial Industry.

Smart investors and worthy professionals will be the beneficiaries of this quickly changing market place!

Buy tickets NOW! (Only 8 seats left)

https://cherifmedawar.leadpages.co/nyc2016meetupfb/

Cherif Medawar, Real Estate Hedge Fund Manager, Educator & Author is hosting a 3-Day event for the financial industry and investors. Cherif will teach and host this interactive round table event and focus on: investment strategies for all levels of real estate, tax incentive programs, and the most creative and applicable structure to protect all assets.

Don’t be last. Be first.

During this 3-Day event Cherif will make you an expert in: the years most important real estate investing trends and business models, the most sought after tax incentives in the nation, technology and crowd funding, and even the most creative ways to structure asset protection and planning.

Come and meet high net worth accredited people at this 3-day event who are learning real estate syndication, crowd funding, and asset protection & tax structures.

Learn the strategies to help your clients invest and make money safely. Plus consult on the most powerful asset protection and tax reduction structures.

                          Dial into the Country’s Most Power Tax Structures

 ·  He will go over his new Fund, which he just launched and how you can join him as a Co-Sponsor. It is a $100 Mil fund that will give you the opportunity to raise capital and get exposed to how a business plan is written to draft a creative (PPM) Private Placement memorandum for the SEC.

·  He’ll teach you tax reduction structures that you can set up for yourself or your clients. Are you paying between 20 and 50% in tax per year? How would you like to reduce it to a flat 15% no matter the amount of your income? On average most companies are paying 35% in taxes each year. If you have been paying 20% or more in taxes in the past then we are about to put a lot of money in your pocket.

·  By day-3 you will be an expert in raising capital through crowd funding. You will understand the regulations, the technology and the players.

·  He’ll teach you how to manage a fund and operate under the exemption rules of the SEC (no need for a license or a high net worth). No one in the country offers such a structure for others to join in like the one Cherif is going to offer. 

·  Become an expert and understand how the latest changes made by the SEC will be the best thing that could ever happen to you as an investor or a professional in the financial industry. No need to compete- COOPERATE!

·  He will give you the nation’s most simple and inexpensive structure to set up for protecting your assets ad estate. He has a proven track record and an endorsement by the top judges in the country. Get the structure!

He is the only one in the U.S. who has strategies for you to apply and grow either on your own or with him in his existing structure, which he’s opening up for professionals to benefit and expand through.  This is the most powerful event you will attend this year.

The event is fast paced and interactive, which gives you the opportunity to learn ask questions and network with other financial professionals, investors, and syndicators.

</a>

Buy tickets with link

<a href="https://lk108.infusionsoft.com/app/manageCart/showManageOrder">https://cherifmedawar.leadpages.co/nyc2016meetupfb/

Other topics include:


Discount Notes

Assign Notes and profit

Buy Notes at a discount to receive a high yield income

Create Notes by selling properties and carrying the financing

Commercial Real Estate in the City

Cherif will cover the latest laws and changes that allow you to grow faster using creative financing and mortgage notes as well as how to use a financial calculator to understand the time value of money.

Buy tickets with link

https://cherifmedawar.leadpages.co/nyc2016meetupfb/

This event will show you not only how it is possible to achieve any of these goals, but in the shortest time possible.

You will also have the opportunity to ask questions, and as always, network with other investors and professionals who have services and information that can be beneficial to all attendees. This is an intensive training and information meeting with immediately usable content and special bonuses.

BONUS

Everyone attending will receive the "3 Week Action Plan and Goal Setting Workbook" to jumpstart your success!

Plus we will have one special guests attending from the Puerto Rico Consulate to discuss the tax strategies between New York and Puerto Rico.

When 

Friday, January 22, to Sunday, January 24, 2016

Time 

Registration on Friday starts at 8:30 a.m.

The Event starts at 9:00 a.m. and will wrap each day by 5:00 p.m.

Where 


Waldorf Astoria New York

301 Park Avenue New York, NY 10022

Parking 

There are 3 public garages and the Waldorf has a garage. No discount available.

Dress 


The dress is always business casual

$29.00 per person with free VIP Upgrade for the 1st 10 people.

This is an exclusive MeetUp discount.

https://cherifmedawar.leadpages.co/nyc2016meetupfb/

Please let us know if anything changes to allow other people to attend.

About the Speaker

Cherif Medawar is a Hedge Fund Manager who teaches his methods and have amounted him a net worth over $50 Mil.

You can easily copy his systems the way he presents because many have done so for the past 15 years. Cherif has over 1000 success stories on YouTube.

Cherif has been investing since the late 80’s and has also been a successful RE Hedge Fund Manager since 2009. He launched his fist real estate hedge fund during the biggest pull back in the real estate market history since the last depression and he has done very well based on the strategies he will share.

Cherif flipped over 1,400 homes that were REOs (bank owned properties) nationwide from 2009 to 2012, and created over 1000 mortgage notes that were sold in the open market.

His MIGSIF Fund currently holds the best inventory of high-end properties in the SF Bay Area market. The homes being flipped are listed at $12 Mil per home. The fund currently is listing approximately $50 Mil worth of assets. Look them up on MIGSIF.com. No one has done such a range of home prices so well for so long.

He is an author of several books and many more to come (he even co-authored a book with Steve Forbes).

He has been teaching his methods since 1999, and he only holds 4 live events per year where people come from all over the country. The space is limited because he wants full interaction to get to know the attendees (so come in prepared).

results.description:
Howdy there! We used to use this Meetup largely to host events at New Work City, but since closing up shop there we're now opening up this group to community-focused coworking events around the city. If you're interested in organizing something, contact Tony through Meetup to learn more!

===

Come work for free at QNS Collective from 9am - 6pm. Afterwards join us for a happy hour, where we’ll be serving drinks and food. Meet our community and get to know others who are interesting in coworking. 

=== 

A little bit about us : 


QNS Collective is a premiere coworking, meeting and event space in the heart of Queens. 

We are Queens’ natives and entrepreneurs who recognized a lack of a creative space for independents. We launched QNS Collective just over a year ago with one mission in mind — Collaborate to Innovate. Like our members, we think independently, but we also know that isolation doesn't breed success. We envision a dynamic space that is constantly being defined by its members, where diverse skill sets and ways of seeing the world lead to ever more ambitious and extraordinary goals. 

If you too can resonate with this message, come get creative, make connections, build with like-minded independents and get work done.

To learn more about us and our message - please visit at http://www.qnscollective.com.

results.description:
Hello Fam!

This week, we are excited to have Joshua Siegel come by and share!. Joshua B. Siegel is the General Partner of Rubicon Venture Capital, a VC fund combined with value added LPs, investing in Later Stage Seed and Series A & B venture capital financing rounds of high potential early stage disruptive technology companies. We operate as a venture capital fund as well as provide a sidecar mechanism for our LPs to invest, on a deal by deal basis, into each startup. Our focus is on FinTech, Adtech, Mobile, Big Data, IoT, Enterprise Saas, B2B, B2C, Hospitality Tech and the like. Rubicon does not invest in Edtech, Healthcare, Pharma, Bio, energy or other capital intensive businesses.

As General Partner - New York, I oversee the day to day activities and operations from evaluating early stage technology companies seeking funding to assisting current portfolio companies with development and interaction with LPs as well as attracting LP capital and development of our network. We leverage our extensive global network of limited partners, accredited angel investors and advisors enabling our portfolio companies access to capital and strategic relationships resulting in partnerships, talent, advisory boards, key customer introductions and leading venture capital firms for follow on funding and ultimately introductions and advice related to buyers for M&A or IPO.

We've co-invested in disruptive companies with notable VCs and angels such as Eric Schmidt, Peter Thiel, Google Ventures, Founders Fund, Sequoia Capital, Menlo Ventures, Battery Ventures, Tomorrow Ventures, Greylock Partners, Formation 8, Y Combinator, SV Angel, Lerer Ventures, HBS Angels, Tech Coast Angels to name a few.

Joshua was formerly the Director of Market Intelligence at Citicorp Debt Capital Markets, Manager Eastern European Banking Systems at Citibank and was with the Overseas Private Investment Corp (OPIC).  In 2002, Joshua established a successful real-estate business – focusing on Historic Real Estate development. In 2007 he became an active angel investor and board advisor in New York with interests in tech, real estate, digital media, consumer products, and luxury lifestyle brands. Joshua holds a BA degree from Boston University, a MBA from Georgetown University and a Degree in Gastronomy from the Institute of Culinary Education in New York.  Joshua was born and raised in New York, attended Horace Mann, and still lives there with his family.

We'll get a chance to hear his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay warm and classy... See you then!

Future Events:

1/28 - Pitch Deck Teardown
1/29 - Frank Barletta (LiveUpTop)
2/05 - Owen Davis (Overlap & NYC Seed)
2/12 - Erica Duignan Minnihan (1000 Angels)
2/19 - Tiffany Yu (Diversability)

results.description:
Note! This event requires registration on our website. Sign-up here.

Over one intense day we’ll cover the most essential topics of workshop and meeting Facilitation.

You’ll work in small groups to learn new skills on group facilitation, planning and management, as well as gaining deeper experience with each. This class isn’t a day of us talking at you, it’s a day of practical exercises and discussions to prepare you for better meeting management. After this workshop and if you’ve already taken our Design Thinking bootcamp, you’ll be ready to apply your facilitation skills to lead teams during The Studio Project. We find the best way to learn is by actually doing the work!

Major points covered:

• Understanding your facilitation styleIcebreakers and energy in the room

• Measuring group dynamics on the fly

• Visual facilitation

• Maintaining energy (especially during ideation and brainstorming sessions)

• Balancing solo time and group thinking

• Open, Explore and Close: Creating Experience Arcs

results.description:
ACC Annual Board of Directors Meeting

January 22, 2016

10:30am –125 Worth Street, NY, NY

Please have your photo ID to gain access into the building.


ACC’s Annual Board of Directors meeting will be held on Friday, January 22, 2016from 10:30am.Following Board business and time permitting, public comment will be heard within the time remaining for the Board meeting. During the time set aside for public comments the Board and/or Executive Director will try to address specific questions or topics that fall within their purview. Individuals who wish to provide public comment must sign in prior to the commencement of the Board Meeting. The public comment sign in sheet will be available in the vestibule outside the auditorium on the 2ndfloor. Individuals will be called based on the order of this sign in sheet. In making a request to provide public comment, individuals must give their names and their title or affiliation. Substitute speakers will not be permitted.

Each speaker will have two (2) minutes to present comments. Time cannot be donated from one speaker to another. Public comment will be received until the scheduled end of the Board meeting.

Anyone who does not have an opportunity to speak during the public comment period or does not want to speak publicly may submit their questions or comments [masked] they can place written comments in the comment/suggestion box available in the vestibule outside the Auditoriumon the day of the meeting. ACC will respond to your comments by e-mail if appropriate.

Team members need to share sensitive data with colleagues within and outside of their organizations. Helping them share data securely and ensuring it doesn’t land in wrong hands is challenging. Azure Rights Management allows you to encrypt files and define permissions on the files that you share with others. You can also track activities on files that you share with others.

results.description:
You need to REGISTER with the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at the following link:

http://register.communitypass.net/Englewood

You may need to set up an account &/or select "Englewood, City of." After you are directed to the Englewood page, click the yellow "Register" button, then the yellow "Continue" button under "2016 Winter Programs, and follow the prompts. To register, you will need to click on or add your child's name and some other information (age, emergency contact, etc.) You will be able to pay the $40 fee online, as well. If you have any trouble, please call the Englewood Parks & Recreation Department at[masked] or email [masked].  Please DO NOT PAY BELOW.

This fee covers all 10 classes.  I hope you will attend ALL 10!!  (There is no refund for missed classes.)

Course:  Fun Fingers

Age Suggestion:  2 1/2 through 5

Class:  Getting Started

Synopsis:  This first class is the most basic.  It introduces the essentials of working in a classroom.  Learning these help both your child and the group cooperate and succeed.  This class begins to teach the children how to sit with others for circle time, how to complete a "work cycle" from choosing an activity to returning it to its correct place, and how to work at a table or on the floor.

Activities:  Pegged Puzzles, Chunky Beads, other Transitional Materials (which are self-explanatory exercises any child can do before learning specific Montessori materials) such as play dough, stamping, a pegboard, Mega Blocks

Adult Learning:  Adults will be made privy to Montessori rationale such as why we use a work mat, why particular apparatus is chosen, how the classroom set-up promotes learning, and various spontaneous information.

A Peek Ahead:  After the first class, lessons are based upon observation, so specifics are unknown.  The goal of the course, however, is to develop fine motor control and hand strength, prerequisites to handwriting.  Materials will be demonstrated to that end.  Many exercises promote these skills.  The following are some exercises that most likely will be presented and then available for the children to choose.

Self Care:  lacing cards, folding scarves, opening and closing containers

Transferring Materials:  using a spoon, tongs, a melon baller, pouring

Extra Care Needed:  cutting, tracing, gluing with a paintbrush, pin pushing

Squeezing:  using a sponge, an eyedropper, clothespins

Come meet other moms and their babies/toddlers for a play date at Andrea’s and check out some great books for your kids. Andrea has a 1 and 3 year old. 

You might know Usborne for their expansive line of sticker and activity books or their popular touch and feel baby books (“That’s Not My…”) but were you aware that they offer almost 2,000 titles? The majority of those titles can’t be found in stores. 

If you are not familiar with Usborne, then please come and get acquainted. If you are familiar, then you know that Usborne is a wonderful company that offers high quality, affordable, educational, and fun books that kids love to read! 

No pressure to buy, browse some books, let your kids play and meet some new moms.

results.description:
New Dates: January 22nd to 24th


We are going to Killington Ski Resort - the biggest & best ski resort in NorthEast. Located in central Vermont, Killington has 141 trails and 21 lifts, extending across six interconnected mountain peaks. The main peak, Killington Peak (4,241 ft (1,293 m)), is the second highest in Vermont and has the second greatest vertical drop in the east (3,050 ft (930 m)) after Whiteface Mountain in Wilmington, New York (at 3,430 ft (1,050 m)). The mountains that make up the Killington resort separate the town of Killington (with its access road) from the city of Rutland, Vermont.

For this trip, we will stay at Comfort Inn in Rutland. We will also have a full size bus so everyone can relate and avoid 5 hours-long drive. Three hot breakfasts are included. Check out the similar trip to Killington & stay at Comfort Inn we had last ski season, with multiple 5 stars rating. All rooms feature micro-wave refrigerators, 32" Flat Screen TVs, Coffee/Tea maker, Hair Dryer, Iron/Ironing Board, Radio Alarm Clock.

New This 2015/2016 Season:  
* Room Renovations are 100% Complete!  
* All Guest Rooms- new EVERYTHING!! 
* New Lobby -Completed- New Guest Computer Room

Return: Depart from Killington at 3:30 PM on Sunday Jan 24th and expect to arrive at NJ at 9:00 PM, NYC at 9:30 PM & Flushing at 10:00 PM.

Hot Breakfast (Included) - Eggs, Sausage, Toasting Breads, Belgium Waffles w/syrup, Bagels/Cream Cheese, Hot and Cold Breakfast Cereals, Yogurt, Bananas, Apples, Oranges, Breakfast Pastries, Juices, Tea, Hot Chocolate, Coffee, Milk

Trip Includes: 2 days 2 nights ski/snowboard trip; 2 nights accommodation at Comfort Inn Rutland. 2 days all mountain lift tickets at Killington. Luxury bus/van round trip transportation from NYC, daily transportation between hotel & ski resort, tolls & parking. 2 daily hot breakfasts.

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate
results.name: Meet and play in Hoboken oder Jersey City ( in German language )

results.description:
Canadian Icewine Festival
Friday, January 22 - Sunday, January 24
Niagara-on-the-Lake Canada
2 Days/2 Nights

Join us for a weekend as we celebrate the 20th Annual Niagara Ice Wine Festival! This will be our 6th time running this trip and we can't wait to return for another awesome weekend. The weekend will be full of award winning ice wine tastings, ornate ice bars with ice wine martini's, an outdoor BBQ, roasting marshmallows infused with ice wine, wine-food pairing, and the almighty Niagara Falls!

Included
Transportation to/from Manhattan/Jersey in private van
Visit 8 different wineries with wine-food pairing at each winery
2 full breakfasts
Visit Niagara Falls during day and evening
Visit the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake
2 night accommodation in a large rented house
MUST have a valid passport!

Sale Price: $499 (expires 12/13)
Base Price: $549 RESERVE CLICK HERE
*See below for payment due dates and procedures*
Cancelation Policy: If canceled 7 days or less no refund. 8-21 days credit for future trip only, 21 days or more full refund minus $15 service fee.

4:45pm Pick up location near Columbus Circle
9/10pm-Approximate return time in NYC

The Niagara Peninsula wine region produces some of the world's finest ice wines, and is internationally recognized for their superior taste and quality. On Friday evening we'll begin our drive to Niagara Canada to our rented house in the Niagara wine country. Saturday morning after a homemade breakfast, we'll start our wine visits to four different wineries, each with different ice wine tastings and food/dessert pairing. By afternoon, we'll visit the ice and snow sculptures as well as the cute stores along the main street of Niagara-on-the-Lake. Into the evening we will visit the Falls to see the colored lights shinning on the half frozen falls. Sunday after our homemade breakfast we'll visit 4 more wineries, paired with food/desserts. Before heading home, we'll pick up lunch and stop to see Niagara Falls by day before heading back to NYC.

Check out these food/desserts pairings with ice wines! Belgian chocolate fondue fountain with fresh fruit, homemade marshmallows infused with ice wine, homemade Belgian-style waffles topped with fresh fruit drizzled with ice wine syrup, and cream of cauliflower soup drizzled with truffle oil, just to name a few....

About the accommodations: 1-2 people per room-each person with their own bed. Couples will get the master bedroom.

Payment Due Dates and Procedures (After Deposit)
All payments must be made on time to secure your spot. You may pay the balance in full anytime on/before the first due date.

You can pay the balance in either 3 ways:
-Quick Chase Pay (Chase account not required)
-Send check to Circle The World P.O.Box 20484 NY, NY 10011
-Pay online through website (a 3% service fee will be added to total)

Due Dates
$299/$345 December 20 (final payment)
(if you signed up after sale price, your final balance is $345)
results.name: 1 Spot Left! +own room-! Niagara Ice Wine Festival (Wine +Food pairing)

results.description:
I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at Think Coffee to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 7 students per group and costs $10/person.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.
results.name: SPANISH! Level intermediate

results.description:
We meet at NYC Guitar School,

251 w 30th St on the 7th Floor (no longer 8th floor)

Check out some videos here:

"Rock Me Baby"

https://vine.co/v/MMOvEWDJTmM

https://vine.co/v/M5L7rPrJdzp

"Bad To The Bone"

https://vine.co/v/h26I1j3J0v7

Blues Jam

"

https://vine.co/v/h26XTIzVWeH

"

For beginners and intermediate players. (We are a very supportive crowd!)

We will warm up by strumming along to great songs then go over blues licks and jam!

BYOB Jam; Hang Out, Drink and Play!

Blues Jam Made Easy; work on pentatonic scales and seventh chords.

This will be a guided blues jam with room for improvement on all levels of playing.

Acoustic guitars are provided. There are a few amps for electric guitars if you bring yours.

Bass players are welcome (bring your own bass)

Ukelele players are welcome (bring your own uke)
results.name: Happy Hour Guitar Jam 2016

venue.name: Rubin Museum of Art - K2 Lounge / Cafe Serai

results.description:
We will have a private reserved section for our meetup groups near the DJ booth expect 200+ in attendance

Photography Exhibit: Steve McCurry: India, co-organized by the Rubin Museum and the International Center of Photography, brings together stunning photographs of India—its people, monuments, landscapes, seasons, and cities—by the renowned photographer Steve McCurry. The exhibition, which is representative of three decades of McCurry’s work, is the first museum presentation to focus on his India photographs and includes some that have never been shown before.

Social Event

We will have multiple groups join us for this great event where we will have optional name tags and introductions for your host. This will be a great opportunity to network as there will be 200+ in attendance and great opportunity to meet new friends and check out the great museum above!

results.name: Finding Love Over 50 At EQUINOX ROSLYN

results.description:
Reports from the Mad River Valley say that more than 20 inches of snow has fallen in the last 8 days.  The weekend temperatures should be comfortable.

There is room on the trip and there will be comfortable accommodations for all.  We welcome late sign ups.  The downhill ski trail counts are increasing and cross country areas are tracked and ready.  Come ski with us!

Take our ski bus and sleep in ski lodge and play in our Vermont snow at our ski areas and enjoy our spacious open bar and feast on our chef prepared meals and dance under our glittery disco ball.   And and and all are welcome on our weekly bus trips to Vermont’s Mad River Valley!

We are an organized, fun, and congenial all volunteer group that make it simple to go on a downhill ski/snowboard/snowshoe/cross country ski weekend outing.  $280 meals, transportation, comfortable lodging included.  Bus pickups on Long Island, in Manhattan, and Ramsey, NJ.

Visit www.Miramar.org for more information and to sign up click HERE. Our snowphone:[masked]-9191. Trip Leader Tom Fleming welcomes you, contact him at  [masked] with any questions. 

Miramar's weekly bus trips to our lodge in Waitsfield Vermont are one of the best ski deals in the New York area. See the whole winter schedule here and join us. You'll be glad you did! Find out more here: http://miramar.org/skiing-and-snowboarding/#!event-list
results.how_to_find_us: To find out more specifics about our Winter Bus Trips, pick-up times and locations go to http://miramar.org/bus-pickup-locations/. You can put your own skis, snowboard, snow shoes, etc. right on the bus. There is ample storage available.
results.name: Miramar Ski Club’s January Snowlebration! January 22-24

results.description:
Come see the following exhibits with us:

Jackson Pollock A Collection Survey[masked]  6:15-7:15

50 paintings, drawings, and prints from MoMA’s collection track Pollock's artistic evolution from the 1930s to the early 1950s. (Second Floor)

Scenes for a New Heritage Contemporary Art from the Collection 7:15-8pm 

This new cross-medium selection of works, created in the past three decades by more than 30 international artists, represents a wide range of approaches to the political, social, and cultural flux that have shaped the current global landscape.  (Second Floor)


Connolly's Restaurant Pub - 8:15pm


Join us at the downstairs bar/table area after the exhibits.

We are a loose knit group of people who like going to museums.  We don't give tours and we don't follow a structure other than the schedule given above. We invite you to meet up with us and make some friends along the way. The best way to make a connection is to join us for food or drinks afterward. 

You are welcome to check out any exhibit you like while at Moma. (we already went to the Picasso exhibit)  We will all meet up again at the entrance on the 54th street side and then go to Connolly's across the street at 8pm. 

Check the meetup page throughout the evening to find out where we are.

Kara Walker from the Contemporary Exhibit:

This is where we will meet:
results.how_to_find_us: Group Meeting Location:  Fountain at Northwest corner of W 54th St. and 6th Ave. Photo posted below.  Look for Susan and John. We will wait from 6-6:15pm.  If anyone is running late, look for us inside.
results.name: JACKSON POLLOCK at MoMA - Free Friday Nights

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

After taking a break for the holidays, we are back!

We have the second floor patio reserved for us at Bourbon Street Bar. This is a great place with lots of space, decent food, and reasonably priced drinks.

The event is free but you pay for your own food and drinks.

I look forward to meeting you all there for fun and conversation.


Anthony
results.how_to_find_us: We will be on the second floor indoor patio
results.name: Meet for drinks and English conversation at our first meeting of 2016

results.description:
#nycgamenight

**** Friday Game Night will again be sponsored by my website, www.blacklatinomedianetwork.com, so admission again will be FREE!!! If you love to play Spades, Bid Whist or any of the old school classic games, while enjoying laughs, great drinks and food in a very cool lounge, be sure to come through and check out Game Night for free on Friday January 22nd!!!***-Sam


You are invited to join us after work on January 22 for our next Game Night  at 49 Grove, downtown in NYC!!!

http://youtu.be/nRGX2TK9ay4

Our event Host Pedro (AKA "Peter") will be your Host for the evening!

49 Grove is a sexy lounge and is a spacious venue, so there is plenty of room to walk around the very attractive space, while mingling with not only other Group members within our VIP section, but with other Latino and Black professionals throughout the rest of the club.

There are two separate rooms with plenty of couches and separate nooks to lounge in!

Start Time: 6pm

End Time: 10pm

At this Meetup, we will have several tables available for those that wish to play cards or board games. The list of games available include:

Spades

Taboo

Backgammon

Dominoes

Chess

Checkers

Uno

Connect 4

Monopoly

Trouble

Life

Scattegories

and MANY MANY MORE!!!

Please note the details below:

You have to tell the doorman that you are on the Black/Latino Afterwork Drinks Meetup Guestlist.

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/adventure-club-the-hidden-galleries-street-art-in-the-lower-east-side-tickets-19794972295?aff=meetup

Join New York Adventure Club as we discover how the chaos of the Lower East Side has shaped—and continues to shape— the destiny of the art world, in the eyes of neighborhood expert and artist Rich Garr.

See and learn who and what inspired today’s fascinating mix of outdoor art, whether it’s a scrawled graffiti tag, a paste-up, or a full scale mural. Besides the latest street art and graffiti pieces, the tour will stop into several art galleries along the way, comparing and contrasting street art with art on gallery walls.

Come early to get a drink at the start of the tour, and stay after for a parting pint to round out this "happy hour" tour!

No street art & galleries tour is ever the same.
results.name: Adventure Club: The Hidden Galleries & Street Art in the Lower East Side

results.description:
I am very pleased to host Esther Dyson as our first speaker for 2016.

Abstract: Esther Dyson, formerly a techy and a trained cosmonaut, is now taking on the new goal of defining and demonstrating health as an asset class – a store of value resident in human bodies. Health is neither directly tangible, nor is it owned, but it does create value (or reduce costs) for entities that should be willing to pay for it – insurers, employers, communities, governments.  Esther discusses how she came to this work and how health can defined and how the value it creates can be measured, attributed and funded. 

This initiative will require a lot of hard work and persuasion to turn this asset into a fungible financial product.  Esther will discuss what can/should we do about the negative externalities of junk food, addictive substances, and other attractions of modern life.

Bio:  Esther Dyson is an angel investor, and the founder of Wellville, a nonprofit initiative to produce health in five small (<200,000 population) US communities.  She is on the board of health-oriented companies including 23andMe and Voxiva. She is an investor in Applied Proteomics, Clover Health, CUR, Eligible API, GeriJoy, Health Tap, HealthLoop, Medesk, Medivo, Medicalgorithmics, Meetup, Omada Health, PatientsLikeMe, PatientsKnowBest, Proofpilot, StartupHealth and others.  In addition, she is on the board of and research subject #3 for the Personal Genome Project. 

Esther received her BA in Economics from Harvard.

Here is a link to her on Twitter: https://twitter.com/edyson

<a href="https://twitter.com/edyson"></a>
results.name: How Data Enables a New Market for Health as an Asset Class

results.description:
DON'T RSVP through Meetup.  RSVP by contacting me directly at [masked] 

Looking to remove unnecessary conflict from your relationships?


Through training in a variety of modalities including Non-Violent Communication, Empathic Listening, and Buddhist meditation my friend William LaRue Ph.D. has developed a course to help people navigate their relationships with greater clarity and compassion. He's coming to NYC to offer a weekend intensive. 

Practices in:
• resilience
• mindfulness
• authentic communication

Grounded in:
• biology
• psychology
• neuroscience

It's free and there are only a limited number of spots. Reserve a space before they fill up / let me know soon if you want in! If you can think of someone else who might be into this please feel free to forward this along to them. Below is more info. Please don't hesitate to reach out to me with questions or to register ([masked])

The Structure of the Compassionate Relating (CR) Course: 


The Compassionate Relating (CR) course is offered as a weekend intensive that helps participants find greater joy and ease through simple yet powerful practices. The practices of CR help us navigate discord in relationships, developing new ways of working with difficult situations. The CR course has three main threads that weave together and support each other.  1) Resilience and meditation skills. These allow us to become more aware of how our minds operate, and provides basis for relating compassionately to the many movements of mind. 

2) Simple yet profound communication skills. These apply the resilience and meditation skills from the first tread within interpersonal dynamics.

3) A scientific framework. Biology and neuroscience are used to understand both why some form of practice is necessary if we are to live satisfying lives, and why particular practices work.  Practices
• Basic communication practices include: embodied listening, paraphrased reflection, seeking to understand others, expressing self-understanding, requests and boundaries
• Resilience practices include: recalling and forming memories of wellbeing, by becoming aware of comfort and ease in the present moment.
• Meditation practices include: mindfulness of breathing, body scan, open monitoring, phrases of forgiveness, and loving-kindness (metta).
• Scientific topics include: the biology of perception, unconsciousness, preferences, hyper-arousal and social roles and counter roles

About The Instructor:  
William LaRue Ph.D. has been taking courses in relationship dynamics since 1985 and loves to reflect on and practice what he's learned. He's a Ph.D in evolutionary biology, a longterm Buddhist mediator, and a former Special Ops Solider in the U.S. Army. Website

http://compassionaterelating.org/about/

Details About the The Manhattan Weekend Intensive

 Time: The course will meet for will meet for 20 hours as follows (attendance at the entire course is required for all participants). January 22nd - 24th
 Friday evening from 6-9pm 
Saturday from 9am-9pm
Sunday from 9am-4pm

Location: Brownstone on 108th street between Broadway and Riverside. More details: We will begin connecting as a group right away through a variety of dyad, triad, and whole group activities. We also spend time reflecting and practicing individually. We will bring our own food and eat lunch and dinner together on Saturday and lunch on Sunday. The time passes swiftly as we explore, learn, and practice in a warm hearted community. Tea breaks afford an opportunity to take practices from the last session into freestyle conversation.

Cost: The course is offered purely on a donation basis. What's important is the commitment to show up for the full course with an open mind and the desire to learn. As you feel moved to and capable of giving to support his work then there will be an opportunity, but no obligation to do so.
results.name: Free Weekend Intensive Meditation and Communication Course

Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.

This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001

results.description:
Take your RSVP Serious.RSVP Only if you are 100% sure you can make it. 

The reason I want to check out this place because it Has almost 5 stars reviews on yelp. with over 100 reviews,

http://www.yelp.com/biz/21-shanghai-house-new-york-4?utm_source=ishare


We are going to eat Family Style, No exception! please read details below. 

• We are going to eat Family Style, I will order assort dishes for everyone. We will split the final bill of food. Every individual is responsible to pay their own drinks.


CASH Only No exception! ( make organizer Job easier! Do not show up with credit card please!) 

The Cost of Food without Drink should be around $25-$33 per person (could been more or less ) , No including Drinks 


• Serious RSVP only. Do not RSVP if you're not certain. 

• "NO-SHOW" or Last day RSVP change Will NOT be tolerated.

• There will be a $3.00 meetup fee and will be added to your bill.

• Cash Only. Very important!!! Makes everyone's life easier...

•  Most restaurant only keep reservation for 15 minutes, so if you are late for more than 15 minutes,The restaurant might take the seat away ( I will do my best to keep it for you , but if restaurant insist there is nothing I can do about it )  so try to be on time please. Thank You. 

• Do not RSVP if you do not agree to all points above.


The Cost of Food without Drink should be around $25-$33 per person (could been more or less ) , No including Drinks

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them whenever and however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!


Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change 
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions 
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress 
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Bodhi Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another. 

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the museum staff for the Buddhist social group!
results.name: Weekly Social with Like Minded Friends @ Rubin Museum Cafe

results.description:
January's caller is Yoyo Zhou all the way from CA and the band is Dance Therapy, Jody Kruskal on concertina, Bill Christophersen on fiddle, and on Indiana Hoover on guitar.


Contra dancing is a great way to have fun, meet new people, burn a few calories and let loose all the stress of the week!

Beginners' Workshop begins at 6:30 pm.  Contra Dance is a traditional American folk dance which requires no prior dance training or experience—if you can walk, you can Contra Dance.  Traditional Contra Dancing is done with "Ladies and Gents" but at Gender Role-Free Dances we dance whichever role we like and with whomever we like!  Our monthly dances are open to everyone, regardless of sexual orientation, gender expression, dance experience and number of left feet.

Join us after the dance for socializing at the Village Den around the corner at 11th St. and Greenwich Ave.


For more information, check out our new website: www.villagecontra.org or our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/villagecontra/
