results.description:
It's been 3 years since the old gang fought the Five Animals, The Time Beast, and rescued Hermel's sister and Yellow Clay Village from Black Patch's Brigands.   They've spent their time happily farming and raising families, selling umbrellas, starting the Rockafella Sulfur mine outside of town, and enjoying the growing prosperity of Yellow Clay.

But as always, things change.  The growing prosperity has come at a cost.  The peaceful rural life that Hermel so loved has been increasingly disrupted by strangers bringing brawls, theft, and now perhaps even murder.  The town council has been unable to stem the tide of troubles, even as the Treasury's coffers have been filling up with gold.   The Rockafella Sulfur Mine seems to have become both a blessing and a curse to the town.

Furthermore recently rumors have it that strange sounds (howlings?) are being heard at night from across the Wild Moors to the west.  Worse yet, several children have vanished in the dead of night ... whisked away from their beds while their hard working parents slept.  A crowd gathers at the Emergency Meeting of Town Council eager to hear what is to be done!

A harrowing adventure was begun that night when Hermel's young daughter was kidnapped during a terrible storm and taken away into the Red Hills by creatures of the night.  Without a second's thought the old gang leaped to action in hot pursuit, taking them into the unknown... down the crooked highway they trod through the stormy night, past the the ancient Scorpion Cave, past the Seven Dead Lake where one died, and another turned aside to pursue his own quest, and Hermel's daughter was rescued from the magical Kobolds.  Finally they came to the mysterious McFearson Farmstead,on the far side of the Red Hills.  They could have turned back.  But there were still three other children to be rescued.  Down the well shaft they descended into the maze of dungeons and caverns, battling the mysterious forces found therein... until finally they came to the haunted cavern-town of Whitewode...

Elthos RPG is an experimental RPG utilizing light-weight mechanics for fast story-oriented play.  We have a couple of open seats for new Players.  The previous Game Test Stories will give you some idea of the nature of the Elthos World, and what kind of adventures one might expect in it.  You're welcome to join in the fun while seats remain open.  To inquire just send me an email and I'll respond asap!

:) Mark
results.why: Its fun!  Especially if you like light weight systems with an emphasis on story, but plenty of tactical elements to make the whole thing a great game.
results.name: Elthos RPG (Experimental) - Yellow Clay Village Campaign

Speed dating is the most effective way for men and women to meet. Nothin' beats meeting someone face to face in a nice and safe environment. Join us for an unforgettable night of speed dating, where you will meet up to 10 African American single professionals just like you in one FUN evening!

How does it work? You will go on about 10 dates with someone of the opposite sex, each date will be 5 minutes long/short. We will provide you with materials to tell us who you liked. Join Us For A Fun Night Of Live Horse Racing @ Victory Sports Bar Located Inside The New Meadowlands Racetrack.  

Come To Eat, Drink, Mingle, Socialize, Gamble & Have A Great Time!

Live Horse Racing from 6:30 to 11pm Will Be Broadcast On Eleven Massive 12×20 Foot Screens! 

We'll Meet At The Bar. I'll Have Some Meetup Signs And Post A Comment On Our Exact Location.

Free Admission / Free To Park or $5 For Valet 

First Time At The New Meadowlands Racetrack??

There are 4 big floors to explore with Live Horse Racing that you can view or bet on from every floor.

1st floor: Victory Sports Bar & Restaurant • Outside eye level view of Live Racing • Food court, cafe & 2 bars

2nd floor: Lounge area and bar • Indoor & Outdoor Stadium seating view of Live Racing

3rd floor: Pink Restaurant with Buffet Dinning & upper level view of the Racetrack

4th floor Rooftop: Bar & rooftop view of the Racetrack

DIRECTIONS:

Victory Is Located Inside The New Meadowlands Racetrack (across from MetLife Stadium and Izod.)

The Google Maps App will take the address 1 Racetrack Dr East Rutherford. Iphone Map, Garmins, Tom Toms etc do a search for Meadowlands Racetrack or Meadowlands Racing. 

Always follow signs for Racetrack or Sports Complex not your GPS. Once your off the highway and inside the sports complex take Berrys Creek Road then turn onto Racetrack Drive. You can just follow the orange & white signs pictured below. Or follow the full directions written on the bottom.

Follow this sign below:

The picture below is where you enter from the parking lot.

As Soon As You Enter The Above Building Victory Is On Your Left.

Below Is A Picture Of The Entrance To Victory Sports Bar.

We'll Meet At The Bar. I'll Have Some Meetup Signs And Post A Comment Of Our Exact Location.

Full Directions

FROM THE GEORGE WASHINGTON BRIDGE
Follow Interstate 95 South signs to the New Jersey Turnpike south western spur (Sports Complex to exit 16W), which provides direct access to the Sports Complex. Once in the Complex, continue on Berrys Creek Road and make a right-hand turn onto Racetrack Drive. The new Grandstand will be on the right side.

FROM THE LINCOLN TUNNEL
Take Route 3 West and follow the signs to the Sports Complex and Racetrack. Once in the Complex, continue on Berrys Creek Road and make a right-hand turn onto Racetrack Drive. The new Grandstand will be on the right side.

TRAVELING NORTH ON THE NEW JERSEY TURNPIKE
Follow the Western Spur (Sports Complex to Exit 16W), which provides direct access to Sports Complex parking areas. If congested, use eastern spur (Lincoln Tunnel) to exit 16E to Route 3 West, follow directions above.

TRAVELING SOUTH ON THE GARDEN STATE PARKWAY
Garden State Parkway South to exit 163 (Route 17). Follow Route 17 to Paterson Plank Road. Take Paterson Plank Road east to the Sports Complex. Once in the Complex, continue on Berrys Creek Road and make a left-hand turn onto Racetrack Drive, the new Grandstand will be on the right side.

TRAVELING NORTH ON THE GARDEN STATE PARKWAY
Garden State Parkway North to exit 153A (Route 3). Follow Route 3 East to the Sports Complex. Once in the Complex, continue on Berrys Creek Road and make a right-hand turn onto Racetrack Drive, the new Grandstand will be on the right side.

FROM HOLLAND TUNNEL OR BROOKLYN-STATEN ISLAND BRIDGE CROSSINGS
Take New Jersey Turnpike extension to the Turnpike North. Follow directions above.

results.description:
After the class we'll all head over to my favorite dive in NYC - Rudy's Bar and Grill! We'll enjoy a few drinks, some free hot dogs, talk shop about what we just learned, and most of all hang out and get to know each other.

•••

We took the Winter off but now we're back and ready to help you with your New Years Resolution to take that plunge and take an improv class! This intro session will cover all of the basic concepts you need to improvise. 

The improv we're gonna focus on is scene-based. How do you create something from absolutely nothing at all? Don't worry, we're not gonna get too heavy. This is a fun and supportive environment where everyone's encouraged to take risks. 

A little bit about me: I've been improvising for 17 years, and I've trained and performed at many venerable improv theaters - The Second City, The UCB, The Magnet, and The Annoyance. 

Space is limited! There is a suggested donation of $10 when you RSVP. If you have any concerns do not hesitate to get in touch with me, I'll do my best to answer any questions.

I hope to see you at the first class of 2016! Keep improvising!

results.description:
Getting Out Of Hell With Dr. Jay Kantor

Now that it seems like we will not be having snow on Friday-Friday night, I’m posting this meetup.

I’ve joked in the past that I should have a business card that said “Going to hell with Dr. Jay Kantor”.  I wondered what that would do for business.  Well, I figured that I would find out by running this meetup.

Have you been living in hell?  Have you been plagued by emotional and psychological problems for a very long time?  Have you tried to avoid feeling bad, really bad, for your entire life?

If you’ve had enough, I’m going to tell you how you can turn your life around….

If you’ve got the courage and are willing to believe what I will tell you in this meetup, you can escape hell and the prison you have put yourself in, in your attempt to keep you safe and pain-free.

In this new year, our group has the room in Panera for our private use starting at 7:30PM.  You can come earlier and find a seat.  At 7:30PM I will tell anyone in the room that we have the room reserved.

Check out my website at http://drjaykantor.Com .

results.description:
On Friday, January 22nd at 7:00 PM, UUCP will be hosting a viewing of the documentary, "Emerson: The Ideal in America". Please join us!


Ralph Waldo Emerson, American essayist, lecturer and poet who led the Transcendentalist movement of the mid-19th century is still seen today as a champion of individualism. His belief in "the infinitude of the private man" still resonates with spiritual seekers today. Most people know Emerson's essay, "Self-Reliance," but there is much more to the fascinating life of the man and his circle, which included Henry David Thoreau, Walt Whitman, and Margaret Fuller. You will never look at Emerson - or yourself - quite the same way again.


"Why should we not also enjoy an original relation to the universe? Why should we not have a poetry and philosophy of insight and not of tradition, and a religion by revelation to us, and not the history of theirs?" (Nature, 1836) 


Bring a friend. We look forward to seeing you!
results.name: Emerson: The Ideal in America (documentary)

results.description:
Please join us to watch a video lecture by Professor Abdullahi An-Naim of Emory University on the "Irrelevance and Relevance of the Sharia and Human Rights".  The lecture considers how the Sharia should be viewed vis a vis Human Rights.  On the surface, there does not seem to be a lot of compatibility between the two.  Many fundamentalist Muslims view the Sharia as a set of divine laws which trump any man made laws such as the United Nation's Universal Declaration of Human Rights.  And some traditional Sharia laws contain punishments that contradict our modern understanding of these Human Rights such as rules for stoning to death adulterers or cutting off the hands of thieves.  

However, Professor An-Naim demonstrates that not only are there many versions of Sharia law, Sharia law was originally thought of as a human endeavor to understand the divine as opposed to a set of definitive divine commandments.  And historically, the founders of the various schools of Islamic Law, such as Abu Hanifa of the Hanafi School, never claimed absolute certainty for these laws such as some fundamentalist Muslims do today.


After we view the lecture we will have a discussion on this topic. Please feel free to bring healthy snacks to share after the screening. 

We ask attendees to contribute $5 each for the rental of the location.
results.name: Human Rights and Islamic Law

Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.

results.description:
Friday nights under the lights! Teams are 7v7, it's a  60min + game and coed friendly.


Pls aim to arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun & chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Emphasis on passing over dribbling.


4) If there are no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP w/ payment. This goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

If you cannot attend, you'll need to update the RSVP 24 hours before the match, in order to receive a match credit. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
Fyodor Dostoevsky in 1866, in serious debt, addicted to roulette and rejected by several women, spun these sad materials into ‘The Gambler’, a brilliant tragicomic novella written in a feverish few weeks to stave off ruin. Olivier-nominated playwright Glyn Maxwell recreates the madness and mayhem of a world enthralled by chance, sex and money, a world without values or foundations, spinning out of control.
Presented by the Award-Winning Phoenix Theatre Ensemble (“One of the Best!” – Wall Street Journal) at the comfortable ground-floor theatre The Wild Project, described by Time Out as “This eco-conscious 90-seat space is a standout, with its stunning wood-and-concrete construction (oozing with green technologies), sweet art gallery and even—when do you rhapsodize about this downtown?—a wonderful bathroom.”
Discount tickets for NYC Theatre on a Budget Meetup @ $15 each. Use the code “Meet2” when ordering your tickets either by phone at[masked] or online at https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pe.c/10016145
Show starts at 8:00 – arrive in lobby of theatre by 7:30 enjoy a beer or wine at concession. Running time is approximately 90 minutes.

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 10 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
Just reserved a table for 15 people. It's a very nice and cozy bar so we can easily talk to each other.  We always try to keep our group small so people can easily talk to everyone. 

Most of us come by ourselves so please do not hesitate if you are on your own.  In fact, it is exactly the purpose of our group.  We care about people who seriously want to make (international) friends and connect with people.  I will walk around talk to everyone and introduce you to our old friends if you are new.  

If you are shy, don't worry. A lot of us were when we didn't know anyone here. We will try to warm you up and entertain you a little bit :) 

However, if you don't want to make efforts talking to our members, simply do not RSVP. Please do us a favor, save the space for people who actually want to make friends. 


Can't wait to see you all!!
results.name: International Happy Hour

group.name: The New York International Happy Hour

results.description:
Do you enjoy winter? Skiing? Snowshoeing? Cross country skiing? Skating? Or just hanging out and cooking? Sign up for this favorite winter meetup!

STATUS: We're fully booked and have no available spots. If you want to come with us, you'll need to arrange for your own accommodation and lift tickets in Stratton. We still have some carpool spots available leaving on Thursday afternoon and returning on Sunday. You can also take a bus on Friday. If you want to come, please e-mail me ASAP.

MORE INFO: Blaze>> has already organized several very successful skiing meetups; check out the last Winter Weekend in Stratton, VT. We will ski, snowboard, xc-ski, snowshoe, skate, cook, play Mafia and Cards Against Humanity - simply have a fun weekend in Vermont this winter as well.


We have a new arrival option this year: We will leave to Stratton in three waves: on Wednesday 1/20/16 after work (no dinner in the condos, cheap skiing on Thu, Fri), on Thursday 1/21/16, and on Friday 1/22/16. All of us will return on Sunday 1/24/16. We plan to carpool or, if necessary, rent cars. Cost of the accommodation will be around $280, $350, or $420 depending on the length of your stay (2, 3, or 4 nights, weeknights are cheaper). Lift tickets, gear rentals, food, drinks, and transportation are extra; however, we will get a BIG group discount if at least 25 people sign up. The final balance will be reconciled at the end of the trip via the usual money spreadsheet.

As last year, also this year we will have more choice regarding accommodation. Those who want to have their own bedroom (occupied by only one person) will have that option (the cost will be as if two people shared the bedroom; i.e., 2x). And those who want to save money can choose to sleep on a sleeper sofa in the living room (no privacy, less comfort, but you will pay only half the regular price; i.e., 0.5x). Everyone else will be in a lottery to share their king/queen bed or have their own twin bed, two people per room.

The condos have fully equipped kitchens with granite countertops, dining room area with a family size table, and a living room with a washer/dryer, TV, phone, and a cozy gas fireplace. Amenities include an outdoors heated pool, hot tub, and a sauna. The slopes are a 10-minute walk. See Stratton, VT for details. Even if you don't ski much, you'll enjoy the gourmet cooking and games we'll play. 

If you have any question, post them in the comments or e-mail me. I will e-mail everyone on the RSVP list in the beginning of November, asking to pay a deposit. The deposit has to be paid by the end of November to have a guaranteed spot. In December I will e-mail you with info how to order deeply discounted lift tickets and rental and to arrange carpooling. And in January you will receive an e-mail with the final instructions. We will also have a social meetup in the city about a week before the trip. 

Milos
results.name: 7th Annual Winter Weekend in Stratton, VT

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.


Fridays, start 8pm
Cost $40, includes tennis, balls and food
6 Indoor hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.


It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE
This is a mix of a Flash Mob, Dance Party, and City Tour all mixed into one incredible night.

With headphones on playing two channels of non-stop party music, we go underground as we hit several iconic NYC subway platforms, terminals and even bars. Unlike your normal subway ride, your Party Tour Guide/MC will not only teach you about the NYC subway system but will have you doing some crazy things to flash mob those unsuspecting passengers and onlookers .

It’s one night you’ll be like, “OMG, did we just do that!?!”

Two channels of music:
Green: Top 40’s/ Dance
Blue: 90’s / 2K / Hip-Hop

Check in Location: Bohemian Beer Garden,[masked]th Avenue, Queens, New York, 11102.
Check out: Studio Square After-Party! (Free access to after-party for all mobile ticket holders) Address:[masked]th Street #4, Queens NY, 11106.
Check in time: 8:00pm – 9:00pm // Leave at: 9:00 pm
Party ends: ~11pm

Special Notes:
Age Restriction: 21+
100 Limited Tickets

What you need:
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed for check-in. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $100. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into any staff member.

results.description:
New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 

****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Stretch and Release) w/ Shoshi Krieger-Joven and Jeanette Catherine
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics ("Muscial Movement") w/ Shawn Hershey</a> 
9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/ <a href="https://www.facebook.com/neil.benen">w/ Jeff Segal and Stanley Tso

Stepping Out Studios is located at 37 West 26th St, 9th Floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the keypad to the right of the building entrance.

****************************************************************************

Did you catch Sarah Elise shakin' her thang? Because, WOW! We are so lucky to have such amazing instructors who are willing to travel to NYC and share their knowledge and skill with us. We have other plans for visiting instructors in the works, so keep an eye on our calendar. In the meantime though, don't knock our local skill: right in NYC's own backyard, we have the famed Shawn Hershey teaching the Extended Topics class this week!

****************************************************************************

JANUARY EXTENDED TOPICS:

"That's My Jam!"Everyone has something they just love. That move, that song, that style that they just can’t stop doing! Come join us for a month of classes - each taught by a different instructor - to learn what inspires them. Use their inspiration to help fuel yours!

This Week: "Musical Movement" with Shawn Hershey
Learn how to create music through movement. Dancers that are fun to watch and to dance with all have a deep connection to the music and specific skills that make that connection possible. We'll work on those skills, such as attack, decay, timing, and how these fit in the context of body movement and partner dancing.


Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 30 to 80 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $20 for the night!

If you see or experience anything that would be considered harmful activity or a breach of etiquette, please speak with our Manager. The Manager on Duty this week is Melissa S Cohen. 


****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE! Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.
results.how_to_find_us: https://www.facebook.com/BluesDanceNewYork/events

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early!  DOORS CLOSE AT 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

Tickets are $10 and can be purchased here: https://www.ticketprophet.com/events/10217/orders/new

I am buying my ticket beforehand and you should too! We can coordinate about meeting up beforehand once people RSVP and we get a sense of who's going.

You can also go to the speed dating event beforehand :-)


**********

Welcome to Nerd Nite NYC
http://nyc.nerdnite.com/

Ring-in the new year with Nerd Nite on Friday January 22 at Le Poisson Rouge in Greenwich Village! As we hurtle toward our ten-year anniversary celebration in March, we bring back Shy so he can uniquely present the science of Star Wars vs. Star Trek, author Myke Cole takes a wargamer’s eye-view of the the 216 BC Battle of Cannae and its 140,000-man knife fight, and we’ll learn about a unique perspective of the Hollywood formula. And best yet, for the first time since last Spring, we bring back speed dating (hetero) so you can find that new love for the new year. Yay! Buy tickets here.
Nerd Nite NYC

158 Bleecker Street (near NYU)

Presentations-only at 8:30pm (Doors at 8:15pm): $10

results.description:
Dearest Fellow Brainiacs,  I know I shared with you info two months ago about November's Nerd Nite, but since many of you seemed to really enjoy it, here's info about our next Nite on Friday January 22 at Le Poisson Rouge (in Manhattan near NYU): 

As we hurtle toward our ten-year anniversary celebration in March, we bring back Shy so he can uniquely present the science of Star Wars vs. Star Trek, author Myke Cole takes a wargamer’s eye-view of the the 216 BC Battle of Cannae and its 140,000-man knife fight, and we’ll learn about a unique perspective of the Hollywood formula.  And best yet, for the first time since last Spring, we bring back speed dating (hetero) so you can find that new love for the new year. Yay!  Buy tickets here.

Nerd Nite NYC
Friday January 22, 2016
Le Poisson Rouge
158 Bleecker Street (near NYU)
Speed Dating + Presentations at 7:00pm (Doors at 6:30pm): $22  (Women Seeking Men sold out)
Presentations-only at 8:30pm (Doors at 8:15pm): $10

Back to the Lectures At-Hand:
*Presentation #1
Star Wars vs. Star Trek
by Shyaporn Theerakulstit

Description: Can the Millennium Falcon outrun the Starship Enterprise?  Is warp drive superior to hyperdrive?  Is a Vulcan more intelligent than a Jedi master?  Nerd Nite all-star presenter Shyaporn Theerakulstit answers all.

Bio: Shy is badass and even internet famous.  We love him.  (Note: Matt wrote this bio on Shy’s behalf)

*Presentation #2
Nerds on Cannae:  A Wargamer’s Eye-View of one of the Greatest Battles in History
by Myke Cole

Description: Wargamers are a special subclass of nerd, with a culture developed enough to produce epic Reddit flame wars (historical vs. fantasy, miniatures vs. counters). Fannish devotion to detail (arms and equipment, troop types, tactical deployment) gives a different perspective than academic historians, one that is more visual, tactile and full of the nerd-squee that keeps us coming to comic cons year after year. In this lecture, we’ll turn the wargaming-nerd’s lens on one of history’s greatest battles: Cannae, 216 BC, the 140,000 man knife-fight that changed the world.

Bio: Myke Cole is the author of the military fantasy SHADOW OPS series (CONTROL POINT, FORTRESS FRONTIER and BREACH ZONE). His latest novel, GEMINI CELL is out now. As a secu­rity con­tractor, gov­ern­ment civilian and mil­i­tary officer, Myke Cole’s career has run the gamut from Coun­tert­er­rorism to Cyber War­fare to Fed­eral Law Enforce­ment. He’s done three tours in Iraq and was recalled to serve during the Deep­water Horizon oil spill. He has his master’s in Museum Studies, and has written for the journals of the American Historical Association and the American Association of Museums.

*Presentation #3
When ______ Met ______ …: The Hollywood Formula’s Mad-Libs Approach to Characters
by Dawson Smith

Description: We all think we know what people mean by “The Hollywood Formula,” and can picture the MacGuffins, chase scenes, gratuitous sex between leads with no chemistry, and shootouts in steamy foundries that come with it. That’s not really what it means, though. It’s an actual concept that has determined the three main characters in Hollywood movies since the golden age of cinema. And we’re gonna talk about it.

Bio: Dawson Smith is a writer, lawyer, and gadabout, though not particularly accomplished at any one of those things. Professionally, he does TV production, so if you want to give him money for that, sidle up to him after the show. He’s obsessed with story theory and forcing other peoples’ art into his ordered little boxes so that he can dissect it in ways only beautiful to him.

Matt

If you like to take a class that goes beyond the basic step, please rsvp the "progressive salsa class event" in this meetup or join the facebook group for more information:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday. You do not need to bring a dance partner since we rotate students so you get to practice with everyone else. But do bring your friends  if you want to and have a blast. Susan's musical group will be performing at this friendly neighborhood Prospect Heights venue. No cover/no minimum. C'mon out and join the fun!

Our repertoire includes 60's & 70's country, folk, rock, soul and some original tunes. Our unique sound which includes harmonica, 12 string guitar, 6-string guitar, percussion and three part harmonies, and our familiar and original feel good tunes, have the audience smiling, dancing and singing along!


We will be at a great Prospect Heights, Brooklyn venue, The Branded Saloon from 8pm-11 pm - no cover/no minimum. HOPE TO SEE YOU THERE!! We'll be in the backroom past the bar.

(Q Train to 7th Avenue; 2 or 3 to Bergen Street, or a 10 min walk from Barclays Center)
results.how_to_find_us: Go through the bar into the back room

results.description:
Karaoke & Anime Night at Action Burger.  We will sing Karaoke on the xbox 360 and watch some anime.  Please vote on which Anime you'll like to watch.  Anime show or movie will be announced in the comments each week.  These are the Anime shows we have:

Gurreen Lagann, Tokyo Ghoul, Rosario & Vampire, Parasite - the Maxim. SteinGate, Akame ga kill, manga nippon mukashkhi, sword art online, attack on titan, sailor moon, Dragon ball, Neon Evangelion.

* Please order food or drinks at this establishment, since it's a free event. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lckXS4XT-ys

Optional $30 open bar (per person) for 3 hours (11pm-2am) includes:

Open bar Drinks: Unlimited 16oz:  Black Island ice tea, Chocolate mint, Sex on the beach, Watermelon paradise, Action Peach fuzz, Peach ale Martini, Orange Waves, Coconut splash, Raspberry ale, Rum & Coke, Vodka & orange juice, Cranberry & Vodka. Selter & Vodka, Selter & Gin, Ginger Ale & Vodka, Ginger Ale & Tequila, Coke & Whiskey, diet Pepsi & Tequila, pineapple juice & Vodka, pineapple & Rum. 

Unlimited shots (Rum, Tequila, Vodka, Scotch).
results.how_to_find_us: 3 blocks from the Graham ave L train station in Williamsburg.

results.description:
Best dang comedy show in the city, baby. 

Come to Chelsea in Manhattan, hang out, have some brews, and enjoy a hilarious show (with pizza after, hey-o!)

There's no door charge and you don't have to buy a drink. Meet new people, or bring your own pals, it's a great time from start to finish. 

Here's what people are saying about standup.NYC:

"I was blown away at the talent." 

"Great time and solid pizza, but be sure to ask for it at the end of the show, Dan and Danny will hook you up." 

"Laid back vibe, perfect for seeing some funny people, hanging out with friends, and only spending as much money as you want to drink"

results.description:
***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.
results.how_to_find_us: Bubble Directions: Hofstra soccer bubble! Use Hofstra Blvd from Hempstead Tpke....from security booth, turn right after 2nd stop sign towards the athletic fields.  Drive all the way down until u c d dome on your right!!

results.description: Let's start by doing a loop around the boathouse and then venture off heading towards Millburn and back to the boathouse. If you wish to stay on the path that's perfectly fine. Your pace your distance. We will do 3-6 miles. Twice around the path will put you at 3.4 miles. For those doing more we will do one loop, head towards Cherry Lane, run a couple of miles towards Millburn and then back to the boathouse to finish off the final loop. Hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Let's meet by the benches behind the restaurant near the water.
results.name: Run Around The Boathouse Path

group.name: West Orange Running Club &  Outdoor Physical Fitness Group

results.description:
Not sure exactly when to call it a season and go hibernating due to or thanks to (?) this year's El Niño, I decided to offer another day hike in Poughkeepsie over Walkway over the Hudson, Hudson Valley Rail Trail, Illinois Mountain Park and Franny Reese State Park followed by microbrew tasting at Mill House Brewing Company and Blue Collar Brewery. Time and energy permitting, we will extend our hike (more like a stroll) by 2.5~3 more miles to College Hill Park and Morgan Lake Park. Or, you have the option to wait for the group at either of the breweries.

The group will meet by the clock tower in GCT at 7:20~7:30 to catch the 7:43 train, which will take us to Poughkeepsie at 9:44. The hike will begin at 10. The drivers should arrive and park at the Poughkeepsie train station lot by 9:50 to sign the waiver form.

The goal is to wrap up the hike by 3~4 pm and enjoy a few local brews at two different breweries before we make our way back into the city. For those who are not interested in drinking could take the train at the end of the hike. The train schedules are listed below for your convenience.

GCT -- Poughkeepsie
7:43 -- 9:44

Poughkeepsie -- GCT
16:52 -- 18:48
17:54 -- 19:48
18:54 - 20:52

One-Way = $17.75
Round Trip = $35.50

Reference:
Walkway Over The Hudson: https://walkway.org/

Hudson Valley Rail Trail: http://hudsonvalleyrailtrail.net/index.php

Illinois Mountain Park: http://www.scenichudson.org/parks/illinoismountain

Franny Reese State Park: http://www.scenichudson.org/parks/frannyreese; http://parks.ny.gov/parks/192/details.aspx; http://www.nynjtc.org/park/franny-reese-state-park

Mill House Brewing Company: http://www.millhousebrewing.com/

Blue Collar Brewery: http://www.thebluecollarbrewery.com/

College Hill Park: http://www.hudsonvalleysojourner.com/blog/college-hill-park-the-highpoint-of-poughkeepsie-ny/

Morgan Lake Park: http://www.morganlakepark.org/index.html

More info here: http://activities.outdoors.org/search/index.cfm/action/details/id/87993
results.name: Young Members - Poughkeepsie & Around + Microbrew Tasting

results.description:
Early Saturday tennis 8:00-10:00. 

Come join us for indoor tennis, Saturday mornings at St. Peter's College in Jersey City. This is additional time before our regular 10:00 - 1:00 spot.

NEW PAYMENT DETAIL: $6.00 online to reserve your spot. $10.00 due at the event (total remains @ $16.00/person).


There is an indoor parking garage (Free) or street parking next to the athletics building. If interested, please rsvp asap to reserve your spot.


**Regarding payment, we will need to collect up front via PayPal.
**You must use the entrance located within the parking garage on Montgomery Street (between John F Kennedy Blvd. and West Side Avenue). Take the elevator to the 4th floor courts. The building is not officially open and all doors are usually locked. Try the buzzer or call myself or Mike (St. Peter's) to gain entrance. Phone numbers sent before the event.


**Some helpful direction guides.

You know why every big company is rushing to adapt IoT in their business?? , why so much Hype around IoT??

Because IoT is the FUTURE.

IoT is applicable everywhere and in every filed of science. It's for everyone.  IoT has unlimited opportunities for Innovation, Jobs, Business, Hobby and Research. Every one of us can find the fit in this new boom. 

We Invite you join us and give your career a boost in this technology revolution.

The Training covers all aspects of IoT like:- 

• Understanding IoT and it's business

• End to End IoT Architecture

• Sensors and Embedded Systems 

• Hardware & Software Platform for IoT

• All network protocols for IoT (to connect devices)

• Cloud, Web Services, Big Data, Big Data Analytic and Visualization

• Practical for all above mention topics 

• Get your hands to hardware and Create your own IoT Devices 

Feel free to reach us through email / phone if you have any query

Ishan

[masked]

[masked]

When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

 

Art of Living Secaucus Center

results.description:
So there's a storm brewing and it may or may not hit NY hard. We've played in major storms before but in consideration of those that have a longer commute we are making this week's game on Saturday at 8:30AM! Whether we play will depend on weather and how many people can commit. Please check this website before you leave your house. I will make a decision by 7:15AM. We do expect snow to start around 6AM Saturday but that's the beginning and the accumulation shouldn't be bad. If Saturday is canceled we may try for this Sunday.

Our games are normally smooth and fun. There was quite a bit of bickering last week which is not acceptable. If you are blocking with your body, shoulder, or elbow instead of your hands that is unacceptable. Neither should you block and seek to push someone to the ground. Being competitive is not an excuse to such physical play and leads to unnecessary injuries and arguments. Name calling or belittling someone is also not acceptable. The persons responsible last week have been warned. Going forward anyone engaging in these activities will be issued a formal warning the first time, suspended a month the second time, and banned for life the third time. This is not a democracy and you will not get a trial. Our decisions are final so do NOT put yourself and us in this spot. Likewise if you believe someone is playing unfairly then talk it out with that person (like an adult and calmly) and report it to the leaders if this continues.

It's very unfortunate GP got injured on a non-contact injury. Linus from Charlie Brown had his blanket for comfort. GP had his under armour shirt but it was cut up in the hospital (I believe). We are all friends and family here so if you're interested we're taking contributions so we can get him a card and gift card. Even if it's not for a shirt maybe he can buy a left handed mouse. The amount is up to your discretion. Please contact Mike if you're interested.

Lastly, the Superbowl is in a few weeks. I'm thinking of doing a box contest. Since this will be for fun and bragging rights it will only cost $1 per box with a max of 4 entries per person. If we sell out all the boxes then the winner of each of the first 3 quarters will get $20 and the winner of quarter 4 will get $40. The numbers for the sides of the boxes will be chosen next week in front of everyone that attends. Again, contact Mike if you are interested.

So unless the weather gets so bad that you can't drive a block away then we will be playing!

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year.

By attending our games you agree to assume any and all risks involved in these games.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the orange cones
results.name: SATURDAY Football 01/23/16 - Please READ full message!

results.description:
Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation: 

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.description:
Registration is now closed for this event.  If interested, we need course volunteers.  Please contact Joe at [masked]

INTRODUCTION

Registration closes 1/10/16

718 Cyclery announces "Fat and Frozen", NYC's first fatbike race. The race will happen on Saturday, January 23rd 2016 at Cunningham Park in Queens NYC. The goal of this event is to raise awareness of large tire off-road riding, as will as showcase the work of CLIMB (Concerned Long Island Mountain Bikers). Registration is required here (please dont register through this Meetup), and beginners are welcome. We anticipate many entries, so please register soon. We will have a fleet of demo fatbikes for test rides and racing!

FATBIKE DEFINITIONS
26+: 26" rims, width >35mm, typically 50mm. Tire widths typically >2.5", e.g. 2.8", 3.0".
27.5+/650+: 27.5" rims, width >35mm, typically 50mm. Tire width typically >2.5", e.g. 2.7"-3,.5".
29+: 29" rims, width >35mm. Tire width typically up to 3.0".
XL: 26" rims, width 60mm-103mm. Tires widths typically >3.5", e.g. 3.8", 4.5", 4.8".
2XL: 26" rims, width[masked]mm. Tire width >5.0".
(From wikipedia.com)

REGISTRATION FEE
Here's how it works:

• CLIMB (Concerned Mountain Bikers of Long Island) Membnersrace for free. Join here

• Or, make a $25 donation to CLIMB (Payment due day of race)

• Or, make a promise to donate 4 hours on a local CLIMB trail crew.

RACE FORMAT AND NOTES
Helmets and brakes required
We will need to be extremely sensitive to ground conditions, monitoring ground moisture and temperature swings. CLINIC AND PRE-RIDE
For those new to fat-biking, we will be holding a clinic and a race course pre-ride to get people familiar. More details to follow.

Registration is required here (please dont register through this Meetup)
results.name: 2016 "Fat and Frozen" Fatbike Race (Registration Closed)

results.description:
The Wittenberg-Cornell-Slide Trail (AKA Burroughs Range Trail)


Very challenging,  but is also one of the most beautiful and exciting  hikes in the Catskill's Slide Mountain Wilderness Area.

You will climb three mountains: Wittenberg, Cornell and Slide Mountains gaining 3,620 feet of elevation! It will not be easy but it will be super fun!

We will start our hike from the trailhead at the Woodland Valley State Campground Parking Lot  following Slide – Cornell – Wittenberg trail all the way over Wittenberg, Cornell and Slide Mountains and finishing at the Slide Mountain Trailhead Parking Lot 


Here are some details:

!!! THIS IS NOT AN EASY HIKE!!!

!!!Snowshoes and  MicroSpikes   - ABSOLUTELY MUST !!!

• THERE WILL BE SOME CHALLENGING ROCK SCRAMBLING 

• MAXIMUM GROUP IS 6 PEOPLE 

• WE HAVE TO START HIKING AT AT 9:30 AM IN ORDER TO FINISH CLIMBING AND START DESCENDING FROM SLIDE MOUNTAIN BEFORE DARK

• WE WILL SWAP CARS BETWEEN Slide Mountain Trailhead Parking Lot AND Woodland Valley State Campground Parking Lot

**********WE WILL MEET HERE @ 9:30  AM *************

Slide Mountain Trailhead Parking Lot 

1983 Oliverea Rd, 

Phoenicia, NY 12464

[masked], [masked]   / Google Street View

       ********We will start our hike from here******** 

Woodland Valley State Campground Parking Lot


951 Woodland Valley Rd

Phoenicia, NY 12464

[masked], [masked]

after leaving one or two cars at Slide Mountain Trailhead Parking Lot

Here is the map of the area:

http://www.dec.ny.gov/docs/lands_forests_pdf/recmapsmwa.pdf


NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION INFO:
http://www.dec.ny.gov/lands/9150.html

Should we successfully finish our hike we will have a great option  to go and enjoy delicious dinner, roast marshmallows on the campfire  and celebrate our adventure at

Peekamoose Restaurant & Tap Room

http://www.peekamooserestaurant.com/
results.name: Burroughs Range Hike

results.description:
Members...we have found a new home for New York's (un)official Manchester United Supporters Group!

Huge thank you to Iona and especially Miguel, but we've now partnered with Berry Park Pub (Berry St & N14th) to host our official match day games.

We're now looking forward to drink deals, two huge screens to watch the game and of course seeing United remain unbeaten in 2016.

Come and find us on the mezzanine in the main bar and enjoy a great selection of beers and other drinks (including refills on coffee and tea), and of course some fantastic food options.


All you need to watch the lads keep winning in 2016. Please make every effort to come join us and help Berry Park to become our new home and fill it with United fans.

Cheers lads!

Ben, Greg, Mark, Alex & Rory

PS. Wear your United shirt, t-shirt, hat or scarf for $1 off any alcoholic beverage you order.

While the job market remains undeniably tight, MBA graduates are still in demand from blue–chip employers. “There's not a huge amount of time on an MBA to stand and stare," says Stanford Business School. “Leaving career planning too late, being too fixed on a particular path or too passive, neglecting soft skills, or "trophy hunting" for glamorous jobs are some of the pitfalls that threaten the route to a successful career”. (The Telegraph, 2013) 

If you are considering to pursue an MBA, meet us at the QS World MBA Tour and Connect 1-2-1 events in New York on Saturday, January 23rd and discuss your MBA requirements with the world’s top business schools. 

New York: QS Connect 1-2-1 Event, January 23rd (10am – 2pm) at the Millennium Broadway Hotel. The perfect opportunity for one-to-one time with MBA admissions directors from the world’s top business schools. Register for this unique opportunity to get the customized attention you need in your MBA search and help you make that important decision. Register for free: http://goo.gl/AVFHcl 

New York: QS World MBA Tour January 23rd (1pm -6:00pm) at the Millennium Broadway Hotel.  Network with admissions directors, alumni and professionals to discover your MBA options. As an event attendee, you can apply for $1.7M of exclusive scholarships to help finance your MBA. 
Register for free: http://goo.gl/BOKxI4 

Make sure you register today for both events, as spaces are limited– they are completely free of charge. Present a copy of this email to obtain free entry to the both events.

Some of the Topics Include the Following:

• Tips and Strategies

• How to Make My Assets Disappear and Take My Identity off the Grid

• Scams to Avoid in Your Business & Personal Lives

• Auto Deduction Strategies Every Business Owner Needs to know to Save Thousands

• Everything Rental Real Estate

Mark J. Kohler, M.Pr.A., C.P.A., J.D., is a best-selling author; national speaker; radio show host; writer and video personality for Entrepreneur.com; real estate investor; senior partner in the law firm, Kyler, Kohler, Ostermiller & Sorensen, and the accounting firm of Kohler & Eyre, CPAs. Mark is a personal and small business tax and legal expert, who helps clients build and protect wealth through wealth management strategies, and business and tax remedies often overlooked in this challenging, ever-changing economic climate. His seminars have helped tens of thousands of individuals and small business owners navigate the maze of legal, regulatory and financial laws to greater success and wealth.

results.description: Join us for a geocaching adventure hike in Campgaw Mountain County Reservation. This park offers many exciting geocaches, including a multicache that's sure to become one of your favorites. A moderate hike of about two miles with many uphill and downhill sections, it's still kid friendly. We recommend trekking poles and a GPS for this adventure. Hope to see you for some geocaching fun. Please make sure you wear appropriate hiking clothing, waterproof footwear (if possible) and dress for the weather (layers; no cotton). Please bring a small day pack with extra clothes, lunch, snacks, water and any personal medications you may need. Ages 8 and up are welcome. Hope to see you on the trail!

If you are considering to pursue an MBA, meet us at the QS World MBA Tour and Connect 1-2-1 events in New York on Saturday, January 23rd and discuss your MBA requirements with the world’s top business schools. 

New York: QS Connect 1-2-1 Event, January 23rd (10am – 2pm) at the Millennium Broadway Hotel. The perfect opportunity for one-to-one time with MBA admissions directors from the world’s top business schools. Register for this unique opportunity to get the customized attention you need in your MBA search and help you make that important decision. Register for free: http://goo.gl/AVFHcl 

New York: QS World MBA Tour January 23rd (1pm -6:00pm) at the Millennium Broadway Hotel.  Network with admissions directors, alumni and professionals to discover your MBA options. As an event attendee, you can apply for $1.7M of exclusive scholarships to help finance your MBA. 
Register for free: http://goo.gl/BOKxI4 

Make sure you register today for both events, as spaces are limited– they are completely free of charge. Present a copy of this email to obtain free entry to the both events.

results.description:
BUILD YOUR FOOD STARTUP TOOLKIT

A one-day intensive sustainable food business workshop led by top startup instructors. Learn startup planning strategies through the lens of your existing food business or new food startup idea. Walk away with actionable next steps for building your company and tools you will use throughout your career.

Learn From Experts

Hands-on workshops taught by experienced food entrepreneurs.

Build Your Business Plan

Rapidly draft and workshop an actionable 12-step startup plan.

Grow Your Company

Develop a fundraising strategy that's right for your food startup.

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

Learn the basics of launching and growing a food startup through instruction, hands-on business workshops and exposure to industry experts. The bootcamp introduces vital business concepts including customer discovery, market and industry analysis, financial forecasting, sales and marketing strategy, development of a social mission statement, fundraising best-practices and how to effectively pitch your food startup.


The bootcamp incorporates startup best practices from Silicon Valley with concepts from radical food system innovation, social entrepreneurship and impact investing.


Register for the bootcamp and PURCHASE A TICKET HERE, thanks!


FAQ


What's included in the price?


• A full day of Food Startup Academy Training

• Access to LFL’s Alumni Meetups and more LFL Alumni Perks

• A delicious and locally sourced lunch

• A course package to take home.

Who teaches the Bootcamp?


Bootcamps are taught by LFL's core team of skilled instructors—Krysia Zajonc and Mateo Aguilar—and experienced food startup founders in New York.

Who should take the Bootcamp?

The Bootcamp is perfect for people interested in using entrepreneurship to build a better food system. Students well suited for our program are those interested in creating startups that offer packaged and prepared food products, catering and food services, urban to medium-scale agricultural products and services, and programs that expand the interest and demand for a more sustainable food system. Not sure if your startup fits into one of these categories? Write to us at [masked].

What size startups should take the Bootcamp?

This course is appropriate for people who are thinking about starting a food business AND for growing food companies. The bootcamp is designed to help you define and execute your most pressing goals whether that be mapping your launch plan or refining your existing operations.

Do I need to be sure of my idea for a startup before taking the Bootcamp?

No, successful startups rely as much on the determination of the entrepreneur as on the idea for a business. If you don't have an idea for a startup but you are committed to helping fix our food system through business, you’ll learn and practice tools that you can use throughout your career. If you have any questions, contact us at [masked].

What can I expect to accomplish by the end of the Bootcamp?

• A business plan and investor pitch OUTLINE

• A place in the rapidly growing network of people committed to building the next wave of sustainable food and farm businesses

• Actionable next steps for launching and growing a food startup

Do I need a laptop to participate?


Participants will need to bring their own laptop or a tablet to the bootcamp.

TESTIMONIALS

“Excellent preparation and pace. The day was jam packed but kept us thoughtful and engaged. The panel discussion was terrific and the feedback of current entrepreneurs is essential for crafting an approach and rethinking weaker points of one’s business plan.”— Kathleen Blakistone, Los Angeles 2015

“You were all great...it was the best workshop and the most bang for the buck anyone could ask for! Extreme clarity for me although I’m well in the process of my startup. Regardless it helped to solidify my ideas and plans. LFL is helping for the change that is so badly needed.”— Peter Schrager, San Francisco 2015

“The 12-point business plan, especially the powerpoint example, was most helpful. It was surprising how effectively the bootcamp could address the concerns and questions of a wide variety of entrepreneurs in the group. Finally, I appreciated the candid answers from the panel. Very inspiring. Keep up the good work!”— Linda Shiue, San Francisco, 2015

“Even with an extremely nascent business plan the bootcamp helped me realize in what direction I could take all of my ideas. The recommendations on customer development and positioning strategy were especially useful for tailoring my over-zealous thinking and helping me focus on one competitive edge at a time.”— Michelle Cashen, New York City, 2014

“The business plan and survey exercises increased my confidence to move forward with the start-up process. The exercises were very valuable practice which helped me answer questions I was unable to answer before.”— Gail Samuels, San Francisco, 2015

“I’m glad we had an opportunity to have a group like LFL come and share this type of info and bring so many of people like us, seeking guidance, together in a group setting...great networking opportunity.”— Liliana Alvarado, Washington D.C., 2014

results.description:
Want to feel more joy, peace and bliss? A deeper connection with others? Find more balance and ease with your stress?

Come ring in the New Year and manifest your intentions through meditation and insight with Bhante Sadhassara in a peaceful setting in Gramercy Park.

When the holidays and festivities are over, it’s a great time to “go within”. A retreat in the heart of winter supports us to feel more grounded and to find clarity on what we truly want to create for ourselves and our relationships.

Bhante will guide us in several loving kindness and breathing meditations combined with walking meditation, so that we can up our focus, clarity and concentration on the changes we wish to make for 2016. We will hold this retreat in noble silence and there will also be question and answer sessions.

Whether you have zero experience with meditation or Buddhism or are a seasoned pro, come and join us Saturday January 23rd from 10:00am – 4:00pm. Perfect for those who cannot get away – this day retreat will meet us in the city!

This is a Dana retreat, meaning you can give whatever feels right for you in cost. It is a gift of the Dhamma (the Teaching of the Buddha) so please come regardless of what you can offer.

Wishing you every good blessing along your path and we hope to see you in the New Year!


Discover the Benefits of Buddhist Meditation with a Real Buddhist Monk 

Have you ever wanted to meditate but don’t know where to start? Do you have an interest in Buddhist teachings but wanted to learn from a live human being rather than Wikipedia? Buddhist monk and teacher Bhante Saddhasara is excited to be able to offer bi-weekly meditation and discussion sessions that will help you reduce your level of stress and bring you a peace of mind which is sadly lacking for most of us living in the urban jungle. 

Whether you have absolutely zero experience with meditation or Buddhism or are a seasoned pro, come and join us every Saturday at 06:00pm for a short meditation and discussion session. This Meetup is offered free of charge as a gift of the Dhamma (the Teaching of the Buddha) so please come and invite your friends. Wishing you every good blessing along your path and we hope to see you at our next get together! 

About Bhante Saddhasara 

Bhante Saddhasara joined the Mahamevnawa Meditation Monastery in Sri Lanka in 2005, became a novice in 2006 under Ven. Kiribatgoda Gnanananda Thero, and after two years of study and practice, attained High Ordination in 2009. After three more years of study, he had begun to develop a deep understanding of insight and tranquility techniques. In 2012 he was asked to begin and to organize a meditation center in Tampa, Florida to provide training to all those who wished to learn. The center was to be non-denominational; anyone of any religion could come and study the practices. Bhante Saddhasara also offered a Recovery Program for those suffering from addiction; an introductory mindfulness program for children; a prison program; and, throughout Florida and throughout the U.S.A, he also gave lectures and provided mindfulness and meditation teaching, as well as private counseling to adults and to youths of all ages. Bhante Saddhasara speaks fluent English and very much enjoys the back and forth of his conversations with Americans.

results.description:
As with all SDI programs, you’ll learn to dive Nitrox the modern way, using a Nitro-programmable dive computer instead of arcane formulas and complicated tables.

EZ Nitrox was developed to introduce even the newest of divers to NITROX Diving

Enroll now to get started with on-line academics which need to be completed before this session.
When you come to the Dive Center we will review the academics and do the practical application session. Here you will get hands-on experience on how to

Analyze: You need to know how to analyze to ensure the proper and safest FO2 for your dive.

Label: Know what to and how to properly mark on your cylinder.

Log: Fill out the blenders log to ensure you get the percentages you asked for.

+: Program a dive computer for Nitrox

Working with an Oxygen analyzer and Dive computer will prepare you to maximize the benefits of Nitrox diving to meet your diving needs.

Pr-registration is required. For more info call[masked]

The SDI OnLine Computer Nitrox course is a great next step after
the Open Water Diver certification and is structured in an easy to understand manner by making use of a Nitrox programmable computer. Nitrox as a breathing gas has a lot of benefits for both new and experienced. The course will cover the use of Nitrox mixtures from 22 to 40 percent oxygen.

The benefits of using Nitrox include
* Increased safety margins
* Reduced post dive fatigue
* Extended no-decompression times

When you have completed the academic review and practical application sessions, we will will process your permanent certification card. What could be easier? Nitrox opens a world of possibilities, leading to better, more enjoyable diving. What are you waiting for?

Cost $129.95 ea.Pay Now  includes the eLearning codes and the practical session.


FAMILY PLAN:  

• Sign up for two is just $224 for both. 

• Additional sign ups $112


SAVE: No, C-Card processing and registration is $24 for this Class

Refresher $29.95 (proof of cert required)

Pay now and I'll email you the access code to start the online academics

Optional Openwater dives can be conducted at Dutch Springs or on one of our Dive Trips

The greatest benefits of Nitrox are found between 0 and 130 feet, and require just a little more training and experience. Nitrox is another tool for divers to use. It is not designed to replace air. Nitrox is ideal for recreational diving. You can gain a safety advantage OR longer bottom times using Nitrox. In either case, many divers report less fatigue and a sense of well-being after Nitrox dives.
In addition to feeling better after diving, the decrease of of nitrogen accumulation also allows:

Increased safety margins when using dive computers.

A significant increase in bottom time no-decompression limits when using Nitrox tables.

A reduction of decompression time if the no-decompression limits are exceeded.

A reduction of possible decompression illness.

Reduces the effects of Nitrogen Narcosis.


What is Nitrox?
Nitrox is simply any mixture of oxygen and nitrogen. Air is made up of 21% oxygen and 79% nitrogen. The name "Nitrox" usually refers to oxygen-nitrogen mixtures containing more than 21% oxygen. Other names for this gas are EANx, Enriched Air Nitrox and Safe Air. There are two standard Nitrox mixtures. Nitrox containing 32% oxygen and Nitrox containing 36% oxygen.

Why should I use Nitrox?
The main benefit to diving with Nitrox is the reduced amount of nitrogen in your breathing gas. Less nitrogen means less risk of getting decompression sickness (DCS), or "the bends". Using Nitrox can also extend your bottom time. Because no-decompression limits are based on nitrogen absorption, less nitrogen means more bottom time. Many divers also claim that they feel less fatigued after diving with Nitrox (as compared to diving with air).

Why do I need a Nitrox Course?
Nitrox, like all other breathing gases (including air), has its safe limits at depth so it is very important to know and understand these limits before you make your first Nitrox dive. You will also need a Nitrox Certification card to purchase mixed gases. To fully understand the benefits of using Nitrox it is important to receive proper training. Classroom sessions include information on the theory of diving Nitrox, blending, dive tables, gas analyzing and dive planning. Upon completion you will receive your certification allowing you to use Nitrox for all your diving adventures.

In addition to feeling better after diving, the decrease of of nitrogen accumulation also allows:
- Increased safety margins when using computers.
- A significant increase in bottom time no-decompression limits when using Dive Computer Nitrox plan.
- A reduction of possible decompression illness.
- A reduction of decompression time if the no-decompression limits are exceeded.
- Reduces the effects of Nitrogen Narcosis.

Nitrox Equipment
Most of your regular scuba equipment will work without modification for use with Nitrox. Your regulator, pressure hoses and other equipment will work just fine.

This MeetUp is for those who:

- Are unhappy in their current job/career -- and are ready to take action

- Want to or have started their own business -- and want to meet their goals

I'm a professional certified career and leadership coach and my purpose is to help you feel more fulfilled every day by aligning with your values and setting clear career goals.

Give your mind and heart a break from the chaos of everyday life! Deeply examine and empty your self to find absolute peace and freedom!

If you are interested in becoming a member of our meditation center we will offer a special discounted price for meetup members only!

results.description:
Let's ring in the new year with a novel about beginnings. Specifically childhood. Esther Freud's first novel Hideous Kinky earned her being named one of the 20 best young British novelists in 1993. The book is just shy of 200 pages, making it an easy post-holiday-season-hangover read. 

This novel is semi-autobiographical and based on the author's own experience of traveling with her mother in North Africa between the ages of four and six. Weaving between the vivid descriptions of life on the move, the desert, and its cast of exotic characters, is a deeply moving tale of what it's like as a child to be part of an unconventional family. Freud is the daughter of the artist Lucien and great-granddaughter of Sigmund; childhood was unlikely ever to be normal. The novel beautifully evokes the bohemian life that she and her sister unwittingly witnessed as children, all the while craving a more stable upbringing. 

Hideous Kinky is the story of a hippie mother and her daughters who travel to Morocco. Events are narrated through the voice of 5-year-old Lucia. As their mother immerses herself in Sufism in her quest for personal fulfillment and spiritual enlightenment, the girls' longing for a normal upbringing intensifies. Freud paints a vivid picture of a country that was the Mecca of the hippie movement in the 1970s but also tells a touching story about childhood that moves and enchants.
results.name: Esther Freud's Hideous Kinky

The Workshop: An Introduction to Algorithmic Trading


The Workshop will give you a strong foundation to craft a trading strategy. The curriculum has been vetted and used to teach by professors at top tier schools including: Harvard, MIT, and Cornell. 

The workshop will:

Give you the ability to create and backtest your own basic trading strategies. Show you how to use algorithmic trading tools that will help you craft your strategies. Teach you how to correct for some statistical biases that can disrupt analysis.

results.description:
We are holding a hands-on introduction to algorithmic trading workshop on January 23rd in New York City. If you would like to attend the workshop, please RSVP here: https://thequantopianworkshopnyc.splashthat.com/.

Introduction to Algorithmic Trading

This introductory level workshop will give you a strong foundation to craft better trading algorithms. 

It will:

• Give you the ability to create and backtest your own basic trading strategies.

• Show you how to use algorithmic trading tools that will help you craft your strategies.

• Teach you how to correct for some of the statistical biases that can disrupt analysis.

The curriculum has been vetted and used to teach lectures by professors at top-tier universities, including: Harvard, Cornell, and Stanford.

Prerequisites to Attend

Attendees should have beginner knowledge of Python and college level math experience. And you will need to bring your laptop. 

Reserve your Spot

Tickets for The Workshop are: $675.00. Meals and snacks will be provided. Space is limited and spots will be on a first come, first serve basis. We are keeping The Quantopian Workshop intentionally small in order to give attendees the best hand-on learning experience. 

For more information and to RSVP, please go here: https://thequantopianworkshopnyc.splashthat.com/.

The Lecturer

The workshop has been developed by Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie, engineer and academic lead at Quantopian, whose focus is on the intersection of computer science, statistics, and finance. His background includes seven years of bioinformatics research and delivering lectures at schools including Harvard and MIT. Have a question or a comment?

Reach out to Delaney at [masked]. He would love to hear from you! 

You can also visit us at: https://www.quantopian.com/workshops.

RSVP

For more information and to RSVP, please go here: https://thequantopianworkshopnyc.splashthat.com/.

Terrific Dim Sum on rolling carts are in constant motion and a variety of dishes in smaller portions completes the menu at Shun Lee Cafe. 

The full restaurant is next door but it is more expensive than the cafe.

results.description:
Hi all,

If Jonas does what it's supposed to do, Mountain Creek and the Poconos are going to get smashed and there's going to be a ton of snow on the streets. So if you're not already carpooling northward, let's shred some handrails and/or try to get to a local mountain.

There are three of us so far, and we're starting tomorrow as soon as the snow starts piling up. We're planning on a riding some handrails at a local spot in Edgewater, NJ (see below) during the day, then Mountain Creek or the Poconos in the evening, into the night. We're playing Sunday by ear. We have a hatchback with AWD and shovels, and one seat open for the evening adventure (can pick up in the Jersey City area, depending on road conditions).  It could be a ton of fun, so comment or message an organizer to make plans to meet up for one or both sessions. 

The video and photo below are of a great spot in Edgewater, NJ just across the Hudson River from Mid-town Manhattan. It's where we're starting as soon as there's enough snow. It's eight sets of 15-25 stair, round, down-rails. It's an incredible set up. The drop-ins are perfect and the rails are really wide. And you can do lines! No joke. We know the place pretty well, it's a lot of fun. If it snows like they say it's going to, there will be all sorts of shred-related urban fun to be had there (and probably anywhere else). Who's game? Let's go shred. 

https://youtu.be/2AVhRYacaNc

And here are links to Mountain Creek and BBJF.

Shred soon,

Jay and the Shredshare Team

www.shredshare.io
results.how_to_find_us: comment on the meetup, email team@shredshare.io or text 646 598 SNOW
results.name: [This weekend!] Local Shred Mission: NYC & Mountain Creek

Using various texts, he will lead an interactive discussion that will focus on Talmudic teachings regarding the ethical treatment of animals and their implications for 21st-century Jews. This talk will take place immediately following Kiddush, a blessing recited over wine or grape juice to sanctify the Sabbath and Jewish Holidays. As an attendee, you will be eligible to apply for exclusive MBA scholarships worth $1.7M and attend panels and seminars to have all of your MBA questions answered in one place.

--- Attend a Connect 1-2-1 forum to arrange personal meetings with a range of top business schools
