results.description:
EXCLUSIVE FREE ENTRY to the World's Top Business School Event

Please click on the following link to REGISTER FOR FREE as an RSVP on this group alone does not guarantee entry to the event.

The QS World MBA Tour will be returning to New York on Saturday, January 23rd at the Millennium Broadway Hotel. We would like to invite you to attend our event for free (a saving of $15) but places are limited so make sure you register today.

As the competition for top jobs becomes fiercer, an MBA can be a critical success factor, providing you with a competitive edge. Understanding what top business schools want is vital to getting into the MBA program of your choice. Our event aims to provide you with the tools

Take advantage of this exclusive opportunity to speak face-to-face with admissions directors from the top local and international business schools. You will also be able to get advice on your MBA applications from experts. Event attendees are eligible to apply for a pool of exclusive MBA scholarships worth $1.7M

Business schools attending in Spring 2016 includes:

*Wharton, *Harvard, *Columbia, Baruch College, New York Institute of Technology,  Rutgers University Business School, Stevens Institute of Technology, George Washington University,  UC San Diego - Rady, University of Arizona - Eller, Boston University, SMU Cox, University of Maryland, University of Miami, West Virginia University, Southampton Business School and many more.

During this event you can:

Ø  Meet face-to-face with admissions directors from top international and local business schools

Ø  Apply for $1.7M of exclusive MBA scholarships to help finance your MBA

Ø  Attend pre fair panel and presentations

Don't forget to register today to guarantee free entry.

We look forward to seeing you there!
results.name: Exclusive Free Entry: Meet The World's Top Business Schools

results.description:
EXCLUSIVE FREE ENTRY to the World's Top Business School Event

Please click on the following link to REGISTER FOR FREE as an RSVP on this group alone does not guarantee entry to the event.

The QS World MBA Tour will be returning to New York on Saturday, January 23rd at the Millennium Broadway Hotel. We would like to invite you to attend our event for free (a saving of $15) but places are limited so make sure you register today.

As the competition for top jobs becomes fiercer, an MBA can be a critical success factor, providing you with a competitive edge. Understanding what top business schools want is vital to getting into the MBA program of your choice. Our event aims to provide you with the tools

Take advantage of this exclusive opportunity to speak face-to-face with admissions directors from the top local and international business schools. You will also be able to get advice on your MBA applications from experts. Event attendees are eligible to apply for a pool of exclusive MBA scholarships worth $1.7M

Business schools attending in Spring 2016 includes:

*Wharton, *Harvard, *Columbia, Baruch College, New York Institute of Technology,  Rutgers University Business School, Stevens Institute of Technology, George Washington University,  UC San Diego - Rady, University of Arizona - Eller, Boston University, SMU Cox, University of Maryland, University of Miami, West Virginia University, Southampton Business School and many more.

During this event you can:

Ø  Meet face-to-face with admissions directors from top international and local business schools

Ø  Apply for $1.7M of exclusive MBA scholarships to help finance your MBA

Ø  Attend pre fair panel and presentations

Don't forget to register today to guarantee free entry.

We look forward to seeing you there!
results.name: Exclusive Free Entry: Meet The World's Top Business Schools

group.name: NYC Young Professionals - Business & Social Networking

venue.address_1: 145 West 44th Street (Between Ave of Americas & 7th Avenue)
venue.name: Millennium Broadway Hotel - Times Square

results.description:
REGISTER FOR FREE: http://goo.gl/zrhp6K

EXCLUSIVE FREE ENTRY: An MBA changes you, professionally and personally: 

Meet us in New York!

The QS World MBA Tour New York will be making a stop at the Millennium Broadway Hotel on January 23rd from 1pm -6pm.

Our event is your opportunity to meet with admissions directors from the top local and international business schools, and network with top tier MBA alumni from Harvard, Wharton and Columbia, who will share their study and career success stories. 

As an attendee, you will be eligible to apply for exclusive MBA scholarships worth $1.7M and attend panels and seminars to have all of your MBA questions answered in one place.

Our goal is to provide ambitious professionals like you with the best tools in order to facilitate your personal and professional development. We ensure that you have access to top business schools and education experts to help make this very important decision.


Attending Business Schools Include:


*Wharton, *Harvard, *Columbia, Baruch College, New York Institute of Technology, Rutgers Univ., George Washington Univ., Boston Univ., SMU Cox, UC San Diego - Rady, Univ. of Arizona - Eller, Univ. of Maryland, Univ. of Miami, Southampton Business School and many more.


*Represented by Alumni

During this event you can:

--- Meet face-to-face with admissions directors from top international and local b-schools

--- Apply for $1.7M of exclusive MBA scholarships to help finance your MBA

--- Network with top tier MBA Alumni members from Harvard, Wharton and Columbia

--- Gain advice on the MBA essay, application and interview

--- Attend a Connect 1-2-1 forum to arrange personal meetings with a range of top business schools

--- Attend an Executive MBA forum to learn more about suitable study options for professionals with six or more years of work experience

--- Attend an inspirational Women in Leadership forum for professional women who are interested in pursuing an MBA

Entry is free for members of Zorka's Family of Meetup Groups, but places are limited so make sure you Register today.

Registration Link: http://goo.gl/zrhp6K

results.description:
REGISTER FOR FREE: http://goo.gl/zrhp6K

EXCLUSIVE FREE ENTRY: An MBA changes you, professionally and personally: 

Meet us in New York!

The QS World MBA Tour New York will be making a stop at the Millennium Broadway Hotel on January 23rd from 1pm -6pm.

Our event is your opportunity to meet with admissions directors from the top local and international business schools, and network with top tier MBA alumni from Harvard, Wharton and Columbia, who will share their study and career success stories. 

As an attendee, you will be eligible to apply for exclusive MBA scholarships worth $1.7M and attend panels and seminars to have all of your MBA questions answered in one place.

Our goal is to provide ambitious professionals like you with the best tools in order to facilitate your personal and professional development. We ensure that you have access to top business schools and education experts to help make this very important decision.


Attending Business Schools Include:


*Wharton, *Harvard, *Columbia, Baruch College, New York Institute of Technology, Rutgers Univ., George Washington Univ., Boston Univ., SMU Cox, UC San Diego - Rady, Univ. of Arizona - Eller, Univ. of Maryland, Univ. of Miami, Southampton Business School and many more.


*Represented by Alumni

During this event you can:

--- Meet face-to-face with admissions directors from top international and local b-schools

--- Apply for $1.7M of exclusive MBA scholarships to help finance your MBA

--- Network with top tier MBA Alumni members from Harvard, Wharton and Columbia

--- Gain advice on the MBA essay, application and interview

--- Attend a Connect 1-2-1 forum to arrange personal meetings with a range of top business schools

--- Attend an Executive MBA forum to learn more about suitable study options for professionals with six or more years of work experience

--- Attend an inspirational Women in Leadership forum for professional women who are interested in pursuing an MBA

Entry is free for members of Zorka's Family of Meetup Groups, but places are limited so make sure you Register today.

results.description:
It's a 11v11 game w/ full size goals at Williamsburg's BIP Field. Pls arrive early and be ready to go on time - Intermediate level.

All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!

****************************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes / molded cleats only. Wear proper Soccer attire.

3) Played in a fun & chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, all players need to rotate in goal. Full size goals.

5) If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


All players must RSVP and make payment before game time. This goes toward  field permits, equipment, meetup & CC fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

If you cannot attend, you'll need to update the RSVP 24 hours before the match, in order to receive a match credit. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you pitch side!

Grand FC

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.
results.name: Saturday 11x11 @1:00pm Williamsburg Brooklyn BIP - CANCELLED

results.description:
Keith L has been trying to get us uptown for sometime, so last weekend, he, Rob, Michael and I finally did some research on bars in the Inwood area. There are a lot of great places but his favorite is Inwood Local and when we went there, we could tell immediately it was a "beer club" kind of place. With an excellent beer list and a cool back area with large tables, it's perfect for our group.

So come uptown, way uptown, and have some beer in Inwood. Easy access via the A or the 1 train, and you can also see some of the monstrous buildings Columbia University has heartlessly thrust upon the neighborhood.

There is a lunch menu with bar foods (chicken wings, etc) available or maybe come early and have lunch at one of the cool restaurants in the neighborhood.

Hope to see you there.

Keith and Bill
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the back
results.name: Let's drink beer in Inwood!- POSTPONED!!!

group.name: New York City Gay Craft Beer Lovers

results.description:
Learn to Salsa New York Style with Yrma Arias at El Taller! This style of Salsa, "On 2", has gained popularity over the last decade in NYC. The classes will focus on the look and feel of the dance - with an emphasis on timing, footwork and partner work. Classes will provide instruction and repetition of the steps ‘Shines’, introduce the importance of the leader/follower connection, and provide practical techniques for the Latin Motion. Particular attention is paid to rhythm and musicality. This is an enjoyable class designed for people of all ages. The most important lesson is to have fun! What to bring: A great attitude and comfortable clothes and shoes that allow you to move!


When you arrive at 215 E. 99th Street, press the El T button on the intercom and we'll buzz you right in!
results.name: Beginner Salsa Dancing

group.name: Spanish, Salsa, and Tango at El Taller!

EXCLUSIVE FREE ENTRY to the World's Top Business School Event

The QS World MBA Tour will be returning to New York on January 23rd at the Millennium Broadway Hotel. We would like to invite you to attend our event for free (a saving of $15) but places are limited so make sure you register today.

As the competition for top jobs becomes fiercer, an MBA can be a critical success factor, providing you with a competitive edge. Understanding what top business schools want is vital to getting into the MBA program of your choice. Our event aims to provide you with the tools

Take advantage of this exclusive opportunity to speak face-to-face with admissions directors from the top local and international business schools. results.description:
Blossom on Columbus:is the chain's newest location where classic Blossom fare is offered in an open and airy space, featuring a full bar with local wine and beer. 


The fresh organic ingredients come from local farms and small distribution companies and all the dishes are completely animal free. Blossom is first and foremost animal caring and is also know as an organic, vegan diet encouraging a healthy lifestyle.

Black-eyed Pea Cake

For brunch try the the Country Breakfast of savory tofu scramble, vegan sausage, toast and apple chutney ($14) There's also French toast, crisp on the outside, soft on the inside with a side of tempeh bacon ($14).  For lunch there's the caesar salad, with its romaine, herbed croutons, gomashio, shiitake mushrooms and caesar dressing ($14) or the "Black-eyed Pea Cake".a favorite which is a breaded and fried potato-and-black-eyed-pea medallion covered in a spicy chipotle sauce ($11) or the all-time favorite, the Soy Bacon Cheeseburger, with caramelized onions, tapioca cheddar, soy bacon, grilled mushrooms, lettuce, tomato, chipotle aioli, sesame seed bun ($15)


A $2.00 fee is requested to help defray the organizer dues payments.  Payment in Cash in appreciated before the event.


View the entire brunch and lunch menus at:

http://www.blossomnyc.com/blossom-restaurant-2

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson as he runs the first D&D 5E Module over two parts!

The Sword Coast is siege. In an audacious bid for power, the Cult of the Dragon, along with its dragon allies and the Red Wizards of Thay, seeks to free Tiamat from her prison in the Nine Hells to bring her to the Forgotten Realms. The cult's forces are sweeping from town to town, laying waste to all who oppose them and gathering a hoard of riches for their dread queen. The threat is so dire, factions as disparate as the Harpers and the Zhentarim are banding together to battle the cult. Never before has the need for heroes been as desperate.

This campaign follows the module of the same name, and will be broken into two parts with six sessions each.

results.description:
Hey guys!! Discover how the chaos of the Lower East Side has shaped—and continues to shape—the destiny of the art world. There’s an incredible amount of street art in New York City whether Banksy (English) or eL Seed (Arabic) have “residencies” here or not. See and learn who and what inspired today’s fascinating mix of paste-ups, stencils, memorials, tags and throws. Get the context behind Banksy’s 2013 street art blitz right here in the streets where hip hop and graffiti began. Besides the latest street art, we’ll explore earlier art in and about the streets, and learn how museums like the New Museum and Warhol Museum have taken note.

To book tickets, please click here: https://goo.gl/OCRu3J

The Union Square Partnership teamed with Big Onion Walking Tours to create a free, 90-minute walking tour Saturdays entitled Union Square: Crossroads of New York. The tour departs from the Abraham Lincoln Statue located along the 16th Street transverse. results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 15 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Have you heard of Ayurveda, but aren’t quite sure what it is? Come learn the basics of Ayurveda to see how you can begin to incorporate some of this ancient wisdom into your life. In this workshop you will learn about the history of Ayurveda, the five elements, the three doshas, the 10 qualities and their opposites and how to incorporate some of the daily rituals of Ayurveda into your life to help build a more balanced lifestyle. Ayurveda can be life changing. So, come and discover how you can make subtle changes to your life that can bring you more balance and ease. 


Kendra Jackson began her practice of yoga in 1998 and from that point on she was hooked. She followed the path of Bikram Yoga for a few years before discovering Vinyasa yoga. In 2006 Kendra completed a 200-hour teacher training with Yoga Works in NYC and taught at a number of New York Sports Club locations. In 2011 She completed her 300-hour advanced teacher training with OM Yoga Center and was on faculty at the studio as well. Kendra has also taught yoga in the corporate world. Today she continues to teach at The Baccalaureate School for Global Education in Astoria, NY where she created a yoga program for grades 7-12. Kendra offeres a free class to the faculty and staff at her school. She completed a 200-hour Foundations of Ayurveda with Kripalu Center for Yoga and Health in 2014 and is currently in the process of finishing her certification to become an Ayurveda Health Counselor with the Himalayan Institute.


Saturday January 23, 20163:00 - 4:30PM

$20 pre-register $25 the day of
results.name: Ayurveda Basics with Kendra Jackson!

results.description:
Meditation is the primary form of service for those following a spiritual path. It is a means of cooperation and alignment with hierarchical intent. The new moon period follows upon the cycle of outbreathing in the rhythmic cycles of the breath; it is a time of pause wherein together we can establish a soul-mind-brain alignment.  During this period we work in thought to concretize the ideas and impressions received at the time of the full moon period and undertake the sometimes difficult process of translating them into practical plans that can be of service in the world. The effect of this meditative effort is to enhance the many ways in which the “power of the one Life” and the “love of the one soul” are working out through all true servers everywhere. 

A major storm is predicted in ‪#‎NewYorkCity‬ on Saturday. Mayor de Blasio is urging people not to travel. Therefore, the meeting in the office has been cancelled. The talk and meditation will be broadcast as scheduled.

‪#‎NewYork‬ Broadcast Info: Join us on Saturday January 23, 2016 at 3:00 PM EST http://www.lucistrust.org/broadcast

The dominant influence of the Festival of ‪#‎Aquarius‬ stimulates the spiritual capacity of man to love and to serve his fellowmen, to become inclusive and compassionate, and to share his own resources freely and fully in seeking to meet the needs he recognises.  Such an influence is greatly needed in a world where humanity has crystallised into a condition of selfishness and separateness.  In the long run nothing can withstand the potent energies pouring through the ‪#‎constellation‬ Aquarius.  These energies are dominated by the second ray of love and wisdom, the fourth ray of harmony through conflict, and the seventh ray of order and organisation with its power to establish relationships and to anchor spiritual energy in material form.

Join in via live stream: http://lucistrust.org/broadcast
results.name: Festival of Aquarius

results.description:
COSTA RICA: 8 Day Group Trip (Jan or July 2016)

- Jan 23 - 30, 2016
- July 9 - 16, 2016

We'll be joining GEC travel club members from all over the US and Canada on this exciting Group Trip to Costa Rica!

Travel January 23 - 30, 2016 or July 9 - 16, 2016! This is an exciting 8 day adventure to Central America's most incredible country, loaded with lots of activities, volcanoes, rainforests, mountains and beaches. This trip is an excellent option for those who wish to see the best of Costa Rica with a group of fun, like-minded adventurers.

NOTE: This trip is immediately AFTER our popular Global Expeditions Club Nicaragua group trip ... why not join both and explore two great countries back to back (Nicaragua and Costa Rica)!

----------------------------------------------------------------- 

Pricing and Booking:

PRICE: $1,499 plus air

CLICK HERE for details & to book your space on this tour.
(NOTE: a meetup RSVP does NOT reserve your space.)

----------------------------------------------------------------- 

GROUP TRIPS:  are typically 10-15 +/- people and they tend to sell out 1 - 3 months before departure, so be sure to book your space soon.  These small group trips are open for anyone to join. You can sign up as a solo traveler (roommate matching is free) OR join with friends, a spouse, or other family members. All are welcome!  

GET THE SCOOP! Want to see what GEC travel club members are saying? Then check out the Global Expeditions Club's Testimonial Page.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Included in the awesome adventure:

* Expert English and Spanish speaking guides and naturalists
* Up close views of an active volcano
* Canyoneering trip
* Rest and relaxation in natural, volcano heated hot springs
* Guided nature walk at the base of a volcano with a local Naturalist
* Scenic horseback ride alone Lake Arenal
* High-wire canopy zipline ride along the roof of the jungle
* Experience of nature at its best
* 3 days / 2 nights at beach
* OPTIONAL: ATV tour or Class 3-4 whitewater rafting

Need help booking your airfare?  Just email me or give me a call at[masked]

Click Here For Complete Details and to Book Your Space on the Trip.

>Places Visited: Costa Rica, Arenal Volcano, La Fortuna, Lake Arenal, Rio Toro, Lost Canyon, San Jose, Samara Beach

----------------------------------------------------------------

The Global Expeditions Club is a group of fun-loving travelers looking for other like-minded people to travel the world with.  The travel club started 8 years ago with just a handful of meetup members, but has grown into one of the largest travel clubs in the world.

Check out the Global Expeditions Club's Testimonial Page to see what others are saying about these trips.

Of course, if you have any questions you can always contact me or one of the other organizers through meetup message or via phone at (617)[masked]


Make Friends. Travel the World.

results.description:
Calling all women ballers that are looking to play some basketball with their fellow ladies.

12 spots will be available for women and half the gym will be used strictly for women's only games.  The other half of the court will be used for a co-ed game.  If you're looking to play only with women, RSVP to this meetup event.  If you're a woman and would prefer to play the with both genders, please RSVP to the other meetup event on this same day.

Other than that, the idea will be basically the same:

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2016 as we're not a litigious group. If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games: 1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event usually sells out by the event day so get your tickets now)

WHERE: Irish Exit Bar & Lounge - 978 2nd Ave (at 52nd St), New York, NY 10022 (In private back bar room)
WHEN: Saturday, January 23rd 2016: 5:30 PM - 7:30 PM (You can arrive at 5:15 to check-in)

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few more cocktails. You'll get to mingle a bit and make some new friends and also get to enter into a fun raffle for a chance to win a prize!

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
Note! This event requires registration on our website. Sign-up here. 

Sketching Bootcamp: Using Visuals to Sell Ideas and Solve Problems

Whiteboard (or flipchart) sketching is the fastest and easiest way to convey your ideas, to help shape the conversations in meetings and foster team alignment…yet many of us don’t feel comfortable in the front of the room with a marker in hand.

In one dynamic day, you’ll get a basic framework for selling ideas, solving problems and sketching complex information in an engaging way. We’ll focus on enhancing your visual vocabulary and building your confidence to create compelling visuals in your everyday work. An expanded visual vocabulary means drawing boxes and arrows that sing, people that don’t look like blobs and leaving with a back pocket full of visual frameworks for all the things you have to communicate.

WHY SPEND A WHOLE DAY DRAWING?

At The Design Gym we’ve been teaching collaborative skills and facilitation for years, to thousands of people. In that time, we’ve witnessed those who are comfortable sketching at the wall being able to command a workshop using visualization to pull the best out of others on their team.

We’re finding that greater visualization skills have become expected in creative fields and a huge differentiator in any role within an organization where selling or conveying ideas is important.We’ve also found that as work projects become more complex, visuals become a way to explain complex or confusing ideas to diverse groups.Generally, visuals you create during a meeting will be more memorable and create better alignment for the team.

WHAT WILL I LEARN AND TAKE BACK TO WORK?

1. VISUAL VOCABULARY

In language we use the alphabet, in visualization there are basic forms to sketch representing people, places, actions or how time has lapsed. Having a larger visual vocabulary means not having to think about what you’re drawing, but focusing on what you want to convey.

2. PROCESS MAPPING

When we’re conveying ideas, the small concepts mentioned above add up to make a story. This story could tell how produce moves from the farm to our table or how cash flows through an organization. Understanding how to put the small pieces together to paint a grander picture is important for systems thinking and strategy.

3. FRAMEWORKS

Flowcharts, pyramid diagrams, bulls-eyes, journey maps…there’s no reason to reinvent the wheel when so many frameworks already exist. Having a good understanding of each type of visual framework and what it does will help you quickly express ideas for yourself and to your team.

4. SUMMARIZING AND PRESENTING DATA

As we start to build confidence in our visual vocabulary, mapping abilities, and have multiple frameworks to choose from, we can now start putting all of these components together. We’ll integrate quantitative and qualitative data into our sketches to sell an idea that helps move an audience to action.

IS THIS COURSE RIGHT FOR ME?

Regardless of your role in the organization, being able to clearly define your thoughts and ideas visually is a valuable skill. In this one-day class, you’ll take your visual skills to the next level with exercises to practice and tools you can use right away to build the confidence to draw out ideas.

ABOUT THE INTRUCTOR: 

John Bloch is a visual facilitator, graphic recorder and art director with over 20 years experience working with companies and organizations including AT&T, Olympus, NYC Mayor’s Office of Tech and Innovation, Price Waterhouse Coopers and the Tribeca Film Institute. He has used his graphic facilitation and recording skills to support conflict resolution, training workshops, hackathons, strategic brainstorming and process development. John also taught concept drawing, industrial and graphic design at Pratt Institute for 10 years.

*We only allot 12 seats to this class for more personalized learning
results.name: Sketching Bootcamp

" Create the highest, grandest vision possible for your life, because you become what you believe" ~ Oprah Winfrey

For those of you who have never created a vision board, its a wonderful opportunity to set goals and visions for your future.

Whether you want to visualize your success, achieve prosperity, success a vision board helps you create and focus on your prize. What is a Vision Board?

A vision board is a tool used to help clarify, concentrate and maintain focus on a specific life goal. Literally, a vision board is any sort of board on which you display images that represent whatever you want to be, do or have in your life. Lets get together for some great conversation, light food and drinks

As our first meetup of 2016, I want to make this meet-up personal and intimate, I will be hosting this event at my residence. Therefore, I will send out the location once you RSVP. I'll provide the food and material you bring the drinks. Let's kick 2016 off making new connections.

This group is about making lasting connections...

Hope to see you there!!!

results.description: Fyodor Dostoevsky in 1866, in serious debt, addicted to roulette and rejected by several women, spun these sad materials into ‘The Gambler’, a brilliant tragicomic novella written in a feverish few weeks to stave off ruin. Olivier-nominated playwright Glyn Maxwell recreates the madness and mayhem of a world enthralled by chance, sex and money, a world without values or foundations, spinning out of control. Presented by the Award-Winning Phoenix Theatre Ensemble (“One of the Best!” – Wall Street Journal) at the comfortable ground-floor theatre The Wild Project, described by Time Out as “This eco-conscious 90-seat space is a standout, with its stunning wood-and-concrete construction (oozing with green technologies), sweet art gallery and even—when do you rhapsodize about this downtown?—a wonderful bathroom.” Discount tickets for NYC Theatre on a Budget Meetup @ $15 each. results.description: This safe and inviting space where everyone can feel free to come as they are and move however they want. There is no judgment and the practice has nothing to do with being a "good" dancer. Dance is joyful and powerful, and it's definitely made all the richer when practiced in a group, where we reflect one another's beauty and hold space for each other's pain. To witness each other and to be seen, so that we can move through the world as our most authentic selves. It's a lot of fun, and also really cathartic, as we feel into our bodies and touch into the deepest parts of ourselves...igniting bliss and releasing any blocks we might be holding. This soulful dance party will draw from various traditions that can help fuel an awesome reconnection with body and soul, including 5Rhythms, Authentic Movement, Ancient Temple Arts, Qigong, and Meditation.

We will return to our favor mountain - Hunter Mountain. It is closer, and has more and better trails. "As the Catskills' premier winter destination, Hunter Mountain celebrates renowned terrain, award-winning facilities and luxury mountainside accommodations together creating a smile on any snow lover's face! Discover Hunter's impressive array of mountainside amenities, including lodging at the Liftside Condominiums and the new four seasons, slopeside Katskill Mountain Club, plus a dozen unique mountain eateries speckled throughout the resort, two full service retail stores and plenty of programs for adults, children, and families."

*** Trip plan email via Eventbrite will be sent out 2 to 3 days before the event providing the details. ***

Date: January 24th, 2016 Sunday. Please arrive 30 minutes earlier. 

Depart 5:45 AM from Brooklyn: (Pacific Branch Library) Southeast corner of 4th Ave. & Pacific St. Brooklyn, NY 11217 Brooklyn, NY 11217 (Map)

Depart 6:30 AM from NYC: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 7:10 AM from NJ: (NJ Transit Ramsey Route 17) 1 Spring St, Ramsey, NJ 07446 (Map)

Return: Depart from Hunter at 4:30 PM and expect to arrive at NYC at 7:30 PM & Queens at 8:00 PM.

* Early birds $79 for first 27 spots
* Regular $89 for last 27 spots.

* $30 to upgrade lift ticket to Beginner Package which include lower-mountain lift ticket, rental (skis or snowboard) & group lesson.

Maximum: 55

Transportation: Bus is included.

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Based on this weekend's severe weather forecast, NYRR is cancelling this event.


http://www.nyrr.org/races-and-events/2016/nyrr-fred-lebow-manhattan-half


This race is sold out.


This race honors the late NYRR president and New York City Marathon co-founder, Fred Lebow [masked]). The course is two-plus loops of Central Park, which can be a challenge in January! Join the mid-winter fun and camaraderie—and perhaps kick off your training for a spring marathon. You'll have lots of good-spirited company, and there'll be classical music (Fred's favorite) at the start as well as inspiring Fred quotes along the course!  

Live unofficial results are available during the race at liveresults.nyrr.org. Features include leaderboards, map tracking, and an individual runner search that can be shared on Facebook and Twitter. Tell your friends and family to follow your progress, and because the system works great on mobile devices, you can get unofficial results right after the race!

Event hashtag: #FLMH—use it in your public tweets and Instagrams to be automatically entered into the new NYRR Social Hashtag Challenge to win prizes!

results.description:
canceled

Recall and Refresh your SCUBA Skills

RSVP required


Has it been a while since you have been diving? Have 12 months gone by and you are planning a big trip? Do you want the reassurance that you are doing everything properly? Lets try to retrieve the data necessary data. The "Total Recall"/Inactive Diver Program will get you back up to speed. During the course, your Instructor will review equipment assembly and maintenance, dive planning, hand signals, proper ascents and descents, emergency procedures, and buoyancy. By the end of this course you will be able to enjoy your next big dive with confidence and ease.

Cost: Depends on what gear you need,

Premium members $29 or free with coupon

$49 Includes Tanks & Weights.

$59 Includes; BCD, Regulator, Instruments, Tanks and Weights.

$69 Includes; Mask, Fins and Snorkel, BCD, Regulator, Instruments, Tanks and Weights.

More info and to Pay.. http://www.1877scubausa.com/refresher

RSVP Now and secure your spot You can also leave a deposit here on the meetup via paypal

Sat. 1/23/16 Update:

This trip is on hold until we have confirmation that Metro North is running again.  Maybe we can meet one hour later but, at this time, I do not know.  I still hope to go out on Sun. morning, but it may need to be an hour or two later than originally planned.  Very sorry.  Blame the snow.

See http://alert.mta.info/ for details

Trip description:

10-12 mile loop of Rockefeller State Park 


Skiing pace: moderately-fast but with a relaxed sit-down lunch break (outdoors).
Terrain: carriage roads on gently rolling hills.
Leader: Robert Matson
RSVP required. Eml: [masked]. This is so I can notify participants of any last minute changes.
Leader cell no.:[masked]

Provide your own skis, poles, boots. No ski rental available.

Meet L at the Philipse Manor station of the Metro North on the northbound platform (town of Sleepy Hollow, NY).
Train arrives: 9:16 AM (departs Grand Central at 8:20 AM)
We will leave promptly after the train arrives.

If we have enough drivers for all participants and space for all our skis, we will drive to Rockefeller State Park (RSP). If we don't, we will walk about a mile to the Old Croton Aquaduct (OCA) Trail, clip in, and ski into RSP.

The intended route will be a full circle of the park, covering 9-11 miles (6-7 hours). If the snow is deep and we're breaking trail, we will ski in a rotating line so everyone gets to break trail but not get exhausted from the effort.

We will stop, sit and relax for a leisurely lunch. Bring a sitpad so you can comfortably sit on the snow. Also bring a warm jacket so you stay warm! While skiing, many of the trails will be open to fields and farmlands, so anticipate cold wind and very little protection from trees.

Join us afterwards for a bite to eat at the Shake Shack in Grand Central.

Pack list:
Snacks, two to three quarts of beverages, lunch, headlamp with new batteries, extra set of new batteries, whistle, compass, trail map, wind proof tops and bottoms (like a rain jacket and rain pants), extra pair of warm socks, foot warmers and a warm parka (in case the group is slower than you expect and also for our lunch stop).

Of course you'll be wearing warm ski clothes, ski boots, gaiters and a day pack.

Recommended: sun screen and sun glasses

Avoid: cotton clothes.

Maps and info.:
http://nysparks.com/parks/attachments/RockefellerTrailMap.pdf
http://nysparks.com/parks/59/maps.aspx

WELCOME 2016! 

As we welcome 2016, let's plant the seed and watch it grow together!  While the air is (finally) crisping and the wind is whispering coming of the snowy tides, it's a perfect opportunity to recuperate, hibernate, and seek introspection.  Come slow and quiet down with us in a weekly cozy practice to balance the Vata (movement/air) dosha and learn how you can best take care of yourself in order to blossom in the Spring...

Platform presentation by Paulo Ribiero, Leader in Training and member of the Bergen County, NJ, Ethical Society.


Given the uneasiness about modern entertainment media, games might not seem like fertile ground for ethical education. However, games have been teaching ethical behavior for thousands of years. Games can place players into moral dilemmas that will test their ethical boundaries or place them in the shoes of someone with whom they would normally be unable to sympathize. Perhaps more important than direct ethical content, games also require players to honor their social relationships and sometimes to work together in groups with others. Paulo Ribeiro will explore the field of tabletop, digital, and physical activity games on the market today that push the bounds of creativity and nurture crucial values and social skills

Regular classes today for Ethics for Children


9:30 a.m. Colloquy - Leader's Study - Self-reflection and meditation on a chosen subject within a nurturing, protected group environment.

Henryka Komanska presides 

Recent political discourse meant to move the US towards limiting the movement and activities of Muslims feels to many to have echoes of 1930’s fascism.  Despite overwhelming evidence to the contrary and the disasters of the past century's experiment with this hateful ideology, some of those on the far right feel we should resurrect some practices from this heinous ideology to win against terrorists in the Middle East.  But just as former fascist regimes were blind to the root causes of social unrest, these arguments fail to grasp the real reasons for the Middle East conflict.  Using environmental models this talk will show why targeting Muslims in no way will reduce one of the most pervasive causes of terrorism in the Middle East; global warming.

results.description:
A WOMEN’S CIRCLE IS AN INTIMATE GATHERING. 

"It is a place where we discover and integrate new blueprints that serve the women we are becoming.  As each woman claims her seat in the circle, we come together as equals united by our common purpose.


ONCE FORMED, THE CIRCLE BECOMES A CONTAINER FOR TRUTH TELLING AND SACRED WITNESSING, HEALING AND TRANSFORMATION.

The demands and frenzy of the outside world are put on pause and we have a rich opportunity to asses our personal needs and fill our cups with the medicine of women’s sacred community.  We sit together and welcome one another just as we are.  Each unique perspective is valued and recognized for we know each vital piece enriches the whole.  We embrace pristine pauses of silence and abandon the need to rescue another woman from her experience and feelings.

Circling together is a dynamic process, each meeting has a different rhythm and tone.  We give ourselves to the flow trusting it to yield exactly that which is needed.  Much of what happens during this time is invisible, but as women we are still able to tap into the creative force and use it to fuel our specific purpose on the planet.  Above all, we know everything good which is generated by our communing will be amplified, and the benefits we reap as individuals will be carried out as blessings to our loved ones, communities, and thus the world."

-Birthing Ourselves Into Being ™

• Our circle will meet for an 8 week cycle. 

• Circle #1 begins as an introduction to the process, setting intentions, and committing to transformation. The following 7 circles are layered in a format that is specific and dependent upon following suit. Thus, it is imperative that Priestesses begin the 8 week cycle from Circle #1. Once the women's circle begins, I will close the group to new members until the next 8 week cycle opens up.

• We will be seated on the floor, without chairs. Choose your attire accordingly. Feel free to bring a pillow or cushion if needed for comfort.


• Circles will open with a guided meditation; led by an experienced female medium. The meditation practice will elevate our collective vibration and set the intention for the circle.


• When relevant, we will incorporate various healing modalities such as yoga poses, aromatherapy, journaling, mindful artwork, poetry, etc…to help facilitate the circle theme that month. You will be given advance notice of such developments.


• $10.00 donation covers maintenance and material costs. Thank you for your participation, support and commitment. I look forward to seeing you at the circle.

big love, brianne.

"There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside of you."

- Maya Angelou

THIS EVENT HAS BEEN CANCELED DUE TO THE SNOW STORM. STAY SAFE AND WARM! WE WILL TRY TO RESCHEDULE THIS FOR THE SPRING. 


Topic:  Life on the US/Mexican Border

Details: Cecile Lumer, Ph.D., will help us begin to understand some of the issues around the US/Mexican border and the people involved. She’ll address the militarization of the border, who lives on the border and what the militarization means to these communities. She’ll also talk about the environmental destruction of the desert due to the wall. And, of course, she will speak of the migrants – who are the migrants? And finally, she’ll introduce us to the many humanitarian groups and individuals that work along the border.

Our speaker says about her background: “I am a botanist. I received my Ph.D. from the joint program between the New York Botanical Garden and CUNY. I have lived, taught and conducted research in NYC, Costa Rica, Puerto Rico, Papua New Guinea, Mexico, and Arizona. I lived in Bisbee, AZ, (for 15 years) along the border with Mexico where I worked with several human rights organizations to help ameliorate the problems migrants dealt with in their journey. As part of this, I was Director of the Migrant Resource Center in Naco, Mexico. Somehow, I managed also to curate the Cochise County Herbarium in Sierra Vista, AZ.”


For more information: http://www.rysec.org/event/life-mexican-border

results.description:
THIS MEETUP IS CANCELED, BECAUSE OF POSSIBLY HUGE SNOW ACCUMULATION ON SUNDAY. I WILL RESCHEDULE THIS EVENT FOR A LATER DATE.

We'll start by visiting the NYC Fire Museum, featuring paintings, photographs, wagons, uniforms, ornate helmets, and equipment from the past three centuries. Then we'll tour several art galleries, some strange (but soothing) art installations, and a biological artifacts shop. And we'll stop for lunch (see below). If you'd prefer to skip the museum, you can meet us in the lobby or outside as we're leaving,  at around 12:50 PM. 


PLEASE READ THESE DETAILS, SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED:

DISTANCE: About 2 miles

PACE: Moderate (45-50 blocks per hour), NOT SLOW. Sorry, I do not enjoy walking slowly and I will not wait for stragglers.

COST: $5 for the museum (reduced group rate), and $2 for me, in part to cover Meetup's organizer fee. 

LUNCH: Bring your own or buy it at or near the lunch stop, a theater cafe that sells $8 sandwiches. Lunch will be around 2 PM.

ENDING TIME: Around 5 PM, but you can leave earlier, of course.

TRANSPORTATION: C, E train to Spring St. (uptown only), or 1 train to Houston or Canal St. For details, consult mta.tripplanner.org, Google Transit (maps.google.com/landing/transit/index.html) and/or a subway map, since those sites do not always list the ideal routes. Also check mta.info/weekender for weekend service changes.

WAITING LIST: Sign up and be patient. The list will shrink or disappear by the morning of the walk, due to cancellations and no-shows, especially at the last minute. As a courtesy to others waiting for a spot, please do not sign up unless you intend to go, rather than just as a placeholder in case nothing better turns up. And don't worry about big crowds--the number who actually show up is generally 35 to 55, no matter how many are signed up or waiting. 

One of the museum's many old fire engines:

https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSz-aHkU4cO0lrMhH3OgkIx9KpIZxYUzuzE2Bc6cBuR7CQf9KkQ0Q
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be wearing a red cap.
results.name: CANCELED: SOHO art galleries & fire museum

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
Located alongside the Meadowbrook Parkway, the park and preserve's most visible symbol is the fully operational  agricultural windmill (situated on the north side of the facility), which is used to circulate the water in two man-made ponds that provide a fresh-water habitat for wildlife.

The site also includes three miles of hiking and jogging trails with 18 exercise stations along the trails.

The preserve's highest point of 115 feet produces tremendous views of the Jones Beach Tower, the New York City skyline and numerous coastal treasures.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the parking lot. I will be there at 12:00
results.name: Norman Levy Park Preserve, Merrick, NY

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
